text: It's a summer day. The heat floats above the pavement. A cab waits in the lot. The large gates of New York's largest prison open and tod group of newly released emerge. They pass a guard who lifts up a copy of The USA Today to reveal the headlines and date that tells us it's 2002. Amongst this group we find a man carrying a small duffel. And we know this man. He is Gordon Gekko. But he is not as slick as we remember... he doesn't have gleam in his eyes or that gel in his hair. No, this is a very different version of the man we remember... because there's nothing behind those eyes... nothing we can read anyway. And he just stands there... coldly watching his recently freed brethren greet their wives and children... reunitin with the people who waited for them... the people who lov them. The cab slowly pulls up and Gordon holds up a finger... w a minute. He glares over to the entrance of the lot... waiting for his people... but they don't come. And the cab waits... Gordon stands there... in the heat.. completely disappointed... and completely alone. And we...
As the white letters reappear on the screen... "As a result... the American economy collapsed... Taken from an article about the pre-crash 1929... ... written by Alan Greenspan."
It's funny, the more we find ourselves slaves of chance... the more superstitious we become. 2.
A gorgeous June Friday.
And that would make Andrew Zabel one superstitious motherfucker. Find ANDREW ZABEL, mid 50s, shaved-head and in good shape

He started every day the same exact way. He would walk his dogs then leave his Gramercy Park condo at seven am on the dot. As Andrew leaves 36 East Gramercy Park East, an impressiv building made of white stone. Andrew wears a suit and holds an umbrella.

And he would take an umbrella with him even when there was no chance of rain... As Andrew heads to a newsstand and throws the INDIAN CLER familiar nod. And without saying a word, the clerk knows exactly what to give him.
He'd buy a journal, a tin of chocolate Altoids and a cold bottle of Poland Springs water.
As Andrew bounds down the stairs and through the gate...
He had timed it out so he wouldn't have to wait more than three minutes for the uptown five train. As Andrew emerges out to the platform and sees the headli from the 5 train coming down the tunnel.
I guess you could say that day was like every other... And as the train approaches... holding that Wall Street Journal... the bottle of water and that tin of Altoids...
Except for one thing... ... Andrew Zabel simply steps forward and falls onto the track. 3. And as the train SLAMS into US...
Which holds for an uncomfortably long moment, then... "Money Never Sleeps" graces the screen... and we move dow below the letters to find...

Now filling the screen. It's of the Dow Jones Industrial Average. It's for the year 2008 and it's down to the right... not good. A circle marks Friday June 13th. Follow a blue line back three days and stop. Another circle is now formed and Matthew Good's "Giant" rings out... CARD: JUNE 6th 2008... 8 DAYS EARLIER...

Opening titles... the workplace throng... listening to th iPods, checking their Blackberrys and sipping their Starbucks. Move with this throng, to the Matthew Good tune, under th opening titles, past 745 Seventh Avenue, the Lehman Broth building... with that giant ticker that rounds the buildi posting Dow 12,579.76 -- +119.86 And keep moving... all is normal in the financial center the universe. Land on a impressive modern building made of glass and st then climb up it to the top... to the penthouse office suites. And push in through the window to be in...
An impressive office with a 180 degree view of southern Manhattan. Zabel sits behind his desk.
Go ahead, open it. And across from Andrew Zabel sits JACOB L. MOORE... who h his bonus check.
Really? On the wall over Zabel's shoulder runs an electronic tick with the major indices and just one stock... ticker KZI.. Keller Zabel Investments. 4.
I thought that because of the problems with the credi--
Screw the credit derivative desk, I don't understand half the shit they do anyway. Zabel forces a smile. But Jacob can tell something's wron with him.
Are you okay? Zabel doesn't answer... he just nods to the envelope.
Open it. He opens the envelope and looks down at the check. $1,450,000. And he can barely contain his excitement.
Thank you. And we get a good look at Jacob now... boyish features th display humility with a trace of mischievousness thrown i He's definitely sexy, definitely cerebral and definitely winning.
I'm proud of you, Jacob. And Jacob tries to play it cool as he looks up at the electronic ticker on the wall... 12,592.46 -- +132.46... $71.67... +$3.12.
Princess cut, platinum banded, five carat, completely colorless round center stone with a medium girdle and excellent polish. Pull back to be in...
Jacob inspects the ring then looks up to the fey salesman
Yeah, it's nice. But here's the thing... He looks around the store for a moment, then... 5.
I want to see the "fuck you" room.
The "fuck you" room?
Yes. The room where you sell me a fuck you ring for fuck you money.
The private client foyer. And with a big smile...
What did I say?

Two bedroom in a Murray Hill high rise. Jacob watches Fox Business on his tv. A much nicer, much bigger, much flatt plasma sits against the wall under it waiting to be installed. A promo plays for a magazine show being narrated by Cody Willard.
Tomorrow night we explore the excesses of hedge fund managers. Different pictures flash on the screen of private jets, massive mansions, expensive watches and wines.

Whether they're spraying $5000 a bottle champagne at Voile Rouge in Saint-Tropez, ordering a $10,000 Martini at The Algonquian Hotel with a diamond on the bottom or eating a gold dusted $175 hamburger at the Wall Street Burger Shoppe... Now the flashes are of some of the top HEDGE FUND MANAGER the business that we'll see later... one of them is a man named BRETTON WOODS... maybe we hold a little longer on h to get a good look... Mid 40s, good looking and refined.
... these cowboys of finance always seem to land on their feet. Jacob lets out a little laugh and mutes the tv. He grabs the phone and makes a call... 6.
I know you're at the fund raiser tonight but I wanted to say hi.

Okay, best part... getting my bonus check. Worst part... He grabs a framed picture of her and looks at it. She's in workout gear, wearing earbuds, obviously just of run, caught off guard and thus flipping him the finger... it's adorable.
... it was right after I ordered lunch and I remembered that we're not seeing each other this weekend. And he finishes his message to her...
Okay, text me yours and I'll read them in my sleep. I love you. As Jacob disconnects and looks out the window... looking at Third Avenue twinkling up into Midtown.

head_text.subj: AND WERE BACK ON THE CHART

text: Where the blue line travels down the Dow trend line, down to the right then stops on Thurs June 12th.

A large space lined with long desks that hold five TRADER each. Each trader has two phones and three huge monitors front of them. It's loud and frenetic. Most of the traders are under thi five, it's a young person's game. Jacob heads in and takes his seat at his desk. It's large than the others and anchors the room... this is his domai Fox Business plays on each of the screens that line the s ubiquitous. (A note, when possible, business news will be droning from television sets throughout this movie in bg. as it is the current soundtrack of New York these days) A trader named WILLY shouts out...
Jake, Glass Works is up nine points on earnings, you want to unload some? 7. Jacob confirms...
Yeah, let's get closer to home. A trader named AUDRY turns to Jacob.
(to Jacob, re Willy) Where's his hat? Willy glares at her.
Mind your own business, Audry.
I had to wear Pfizer on my forehead for a full week... so post it up, bitch. Willy pleads with Jacob...
C'mon Jake, it's embarrassing. Jacob just shrugs...

The stock goes down, you wear the crown... them's the rules. Audry grins in victory. Willy shakes his head, grabs a marker, scribbles somethin down on a post-it then places it on his forehead. It read "I bought Toll Brothers at $24" and he has to wear it all week. And Jacob laughs... now looking up at the electronic ticker... KZI $60.21... -$2.25...

An ultra exclusive club reserved for Wall Street money-me Hollywood players, gangstas and supermodels. TI's "Whatever You Like" blares. The dance floor is packed with New York's privileged drap in Prada and dripped in sweat. Jacob heads a table of five men who are all in suits. The are all in various areas of finance... a HEDGE FUND Portf Manager, a DERIVATIVES TRADER, a PRIVATE EQUITY CFO and a QUANT ANALYST. The quant stares at a HIGH CLASS CALL GIRL working the ro across the way. He then turns back to the guys with... 8.
Girl like that cost a thousand bucks last year... now it's up to five.
Getting priced out of the hooker bubble? Confirming in frustration...
Goddamn bull market's killing my sex life. They all laugh.
Don't worry... it's not such a bull market anymore. She'll be trading at five hundred soon enough. The laughter dies down.
(turning to Jacob) It's true. I'm actually shocked KZI gave you a bonus of that size.
Why? Private Equity CFO nudges Hedge Fund PM in reference to t woman who just took the seat at the next table...
Yeah, I'm going long Boeing.
Oh, I didn't notice. Confused...
Really? The 787 is having problems. As Hedge Fund PM opens a bottle of Krug, Clos du Mesnil 1 and pours it into the flutes.
(to Derivatives Trader) Why? Why are you so shocked? Offering Jacob a flute...
Because they're in serious trouble. Declining the champagne... 9.
We're not in serious trouble. It's a rumor. A woman takes the table next to them and this makes Derivatives Trader perk up and say.
I think Goodyear Tire is definitely a buy. Hedge Fund PM checks out the woman.
Totally. And those tires are real. Even more confused...
Goodyear? The chart is horrible.
Somebody color the quant in here. Hedge Fund PM leans into Quant and explains...
Boeing, ticker BA... Big Ass. Goodyear, ticker GT... Great Tits.
(realizing...) Oh, it's like a code. And Private Equity CFO turns to Jacob with...
You guys were down three points in an up market today.
Whatever, somebody was adding to their short. As a supermodel now joins the next table.
Going long Starwood. Starwood's a buy!
(figuring it out) Starwood, ticker HOT. Yeah but... I'm more a buyer of... (thinks for a minute) GDFS.
What the fuck is that? 10.
It's an exchange traded fund that tracks the Guinian Franc.
Okay, whatever -- what's it code for? And Quant looks over to the model then back proudly with.
Gold Digger Freak Show. The guys just shake their heads...
Jacob and Derivatives Trader enjoy the summer night. Out all the guys, he's closest to Jacob. His name is Robby.
Can I ask you something, Robby? Robby nods.
What's your number?
Huh?
You know what I mean. The amount of money you would need to fuck it all and walk away... if you wanted to.
Do you want to walk away?
Not now. But one day... I don't know. When I have a family. It's just so consuming... so many marriages get
Wall Street divorce lawyers do great in any market.
Exactly.
I've thought about it. What I would need... to raise a family, live a good life, be secure. It's not as much as we would think if you move out of New York. And it dawns on Robby... 11.
Aha... when did you buy the ring? Jacob smiles at his friend's perception.
Last week.
So when are you going to ask her?
I'm going to DC this weekend.
Good. I like her for you. She's one of the good ones...
Did you hear what her father said on Charlie Rose? Jacob shakes his head.
Something about Bear Stearns being the first rain drop of the impending mother of all storms.
Sour grapes.
He's speaking at Columbia on Friday. If it's slow enough, a few of us might play hookie and check it out... he's the best show in town. And they continue to walk, until...
Tell me what you hear. Robby slowly nods...
I don't think you want to hear it, bro. You worship Zabel and it's not good.
I don't worship him. He's done a lot for me and I've known him a long time. But he's been acting strange lately.
Just tell me what you hear.
That Keller Zabel is holding toxic waste they can't find a market for. 12. Jacob shakes his head...
It's not true. It's rumors. There are hedge funds with huge short positions...
Jacob, you know better. You know it doesn't matter if they're rumors or not. And Robby stops walking.
Senior year I couldn't get my mind around how all those dot coms with no earnings were worth billions of dollars and you were the one who said something that made it all clear for me.
I don't remember. Turning to Jacob with...
"An asset's value can only be priced at its perception."
I said that? Robby confirms... then...
So buddy -- it don't matter if the rumors are true or not. Because in this climate... if they exist at all... then most likely... Looking his friend head on...
... you're going to cease to.
Jacob leaves his Murray Hill building apartment and nods his doorman, DIEGO.
J to the Acob -- morning to you, brother. Jacob smiles...
Diego... 13. And Jacob waits for the morning joke.
Okay, what's the best aphrodisiac on Wall Street?
I don't know.

Jet fuel. Diego cracks up. Jacob just shakes his head and moves on. And Jacob walks uptown... deep in thought. It's a gorgeou June Friday. Suddenly, Jacob just stops walking and stands there for a long moment... coming to a decision. And as Jacob turns around and starts heading the other wa
Jacob smiles to the doorman.
I'm here to see Andrew Zabel.
Is he expecting you?
No.
The elevator opens and Andrew Zabel appears with two ador Bichon Frise puppies. Jacob stands.
Jacob...
Andy. I'm sorry to come by like this but the rumors are now hitting a fever pitch and I wanted to make sure everything was okay. Zabel nods and heads for the door.
Come on...
As they enter through the gates of the park and walk... 14.
Is everything okay? And Andrew Zabel doesn't seem all there... introspective blank.
I remember when the starter gave me this bushy hair twelve year old kid and I said; "Donny, what the fuck -- give me a real caddy." And he said; "This kid's the best."
And you were. You had the wind down, the grade of every green.
What's going on?
But you wouldn't shut up about stocks. Twelve years old and you blabbed on and on about companies and sectors and earnings.
Andy, are we going under?
What was that piece of shit you loved? That airline equipment supplier who was branching out into car airbags--
Flour Controls. Are you okay? Zabel laughs.
Flour Controls... what a dog.
Why did you give me that bonus? Zabel stops walking and faces Jacob with...
Because I know you, Jacob. And I know you've been holding off because you didn't think you had enough. We all do that... postpone life until we believe we have what it takes to actually live it. 15.
There isn't a better money-runner on the street... we'll get through this.
Marry her, Jacob. And have children with her and spend as much time as you can with them... and never forget that that's what's important. And Jacob L. Moore... looking his boss head on...
Andrew, if there's anyway I can help -- give back the bonus -- whatever... all you have to do is say the word. And Zabel just looks away...
There's just so much you don't know, Jacob.
The normally very loud and frenetic place is very quiet a sober today. They all watch Alexis Glick report...

Rumors of insolvency have hit the street concerning KZI's books and they're shooting first then asking questions later. The stock is now trading just a bit over thirty one dollars a share, down almost forty four percent on the session. And standing in the center of the floor, watching this...
Stunned... horrified... his universe becoming unglued. And he turns to Audry... helpless and in shock.

Who did this to us? She can only shrug... tears in her eyes. Jacob shifts his gaze over to the trading floor's electro ticker on the wall... KZI $26.34... -$29.57. And he moves for the elevator banks... unable to take it anymore.
Furious, Jacob walks down 6th ave with his phone to his e 16.
Andrew, call me back. I'm going to find out who did this to us. I swear to God... if it's the last thing I do.

We're going to bounce back from this. And we're going to find out who spread the rumor... and then we're going to destroy them. He disconnects the call and keeps walking. After a beat, with his anger brewing... Jacob SLAMS his p down on the ground and it shatters.

Jacob lays on his couch vacantly pondering the ceiling. Fox Business plays on the new plasma tv on the wall... footage of THE GOVERNOR OF NEW YORK, a tough looking man his 40s, speaking to the press outside of The State Capit

I don't know anything about the solvency of Keller Zabel. I do know that what's bringing down the stock at this precise moment are rumors. And this practice of short selling American financial institutions then floating rumors in order to profit from them must be stopped. The uptick rule must be reinstated. Jacob glares over to the tv.

And once again, I will point to largely unregulated world of hedge funds... an ever-growing and increasing powerful area of the market that I repeatedly tried to regulate as Chairman of the SEC... And there's a loud knock on the door. Jacob ignores it.
And the collapse of this legendary New York financial institution is why I continue to fight that battle as Governor of this great state. Another knock... this time louder. Jacob mutes the tv.
What? From the door... 17.
Jacob... answer the door. Jacob gets up, moves slowly and answers the door.
You weren't answering your phone.
It broke. Robby sharply nods.
Dude... He stops short... swallows...
What?
I just found this out and it hasn't hit the press yet. Once again... he stops short and looks away in frustratio
What? Robby, what are you trying to say?
Andrew Zabel threw himself in front of the subway this morning. Jacob just stands in that doorway. No reaction at all. Absolutely frozen.

Jacob now stands in the center of his apartment. Complete in shock. As he looks to the plasma... Fox Business on mu Brian Sullivan reporting under the graphic KZI $19.34... $37.28. He glares at it for a long moment, then... almost calmly picks up a chair and throws it into the tv... which shatt And Jacob... not sure what to do. Until... he turns and sees... on the dresser... a gorgeous engagement ring sitt in an open box... a fuck you ring.
As Jacob bounds the steps of the Business School and head into the old stone building. 18.

location: COLUMBIA SCHOOL OF BUSINESS/URIS LECTURE HALL

text: The lecture hall is packed with wall to wall students. Ja stands at the back. A PROFESSOR is at the podium.
Our speaker today has quite a checkered background in the world of finance. Some laughter from the room.

He graduated from City College in 1966 and became a securities broker at Hudson River Bank then moved on to Smith Barney. In 1973 he went out on his own to establish a spectacular career as a independent trader then an active participant in the LBO craze of the 1980s.

In 1988, he was indicted for insider trading and then charged with other various forms of securities fraud and IRS violations. In one of the most harshest sentences ever given to a white collar criminal... he served fourteen years in a maximum security prison and he wants me to stress that it was not a country club. Again laughter from the floor.

Since his release in 2002, he has written and has spoken publicly about what he refers to as the current state of the world economy. He is not allowed to trade on the US exchanges. His new book "Moral Hazard! Why Wall Street Has Finally Gone Too Far." comes out in October.
Please welcome... Gordon Gekko! The room applauds... and out to the podium slowly walks..

No swagger in his step... not in a suit... hair not slick back... but still looks fucking good. As he waits for the applause to wind down... and even a little longer... surveying every corner of the large room commanding its full attention... getting it... holding th silence... until finally... he leans into the mic and say 19.
You're all pretty much fucked. The room breaks into laughter... Gordon smiles and waits it to die down.

What's not funny is what's happening out there. I don't think people get it. And I know the financial center of the world doesn't get it... which happens to be Washington DC now. As he takes to a pace...

To understand where we are, we need to understand how we got here. No good deed goes unpunished, all fires start with a well meaning spark and we wanted Americans to be able to afford homes. Sounds nice enough... lets try to get the middle and lower classes into homes they can own. So we made money cheap and lowered restrictions on mortgage lending. As he takes a moment and looks over the room...
Somebody reminded me the other night that I once said "greed is good." I swear I don't remember it but it sounds like something I would say in the Eighties.

And I was right then. Greed was good. America needed greed and risk-taking and leverage to get to become the superpower we are... or were. And capitalism needed greed and risk and leverage to become the economic platform it has become... but those same attributes that got us there are now the liabilities that threaten to destroy us. Jacob's blackberry vibrates and he checks it. He has a te "KZI!!! -- wtf?"
So greed has been redefined. Who knows -- maybe it was always like this and like everything else in this world, it's good and it is evil. Taking a moment to survey the room... 20.

Because people -- it's greed that caused someone who aspires to own a seven-hundred thousand dollar house they can't afford, to take on a loan they'll never be able to pay back... and it's greed that caused their mortgage lender to give them that loan then sell it right away... and it's greed that caused the buyer of that loan to slice it into a million little pieces then spit them all over the world... and it's greed that caused the rating agency to give that toxic loan a triple-A rating just because it was mixed in with some good loans... and it's greed that caused the insurance company to insure that loan. Jacob quickly glances down again at his blackberry and ch the quote, KZI $14.53.
They were insuring the end of the world; "When the world explodes... just find us in the rubble and we'll be sure to pay your claim." Drawing in a deep breath...
CMO's, CLO's, CBO's, CDO's, CDS's, SPE's, ABCP's,SIV's, REMIC's, CMBS's, toxic traunches, ninja loans, credit default swaps, affinity marketing, stapled financing, synthetic securitization.
Maybe I was in prison too long but I have no idea what half that shit means. The room laughs in agreement.
And I'm considered a pretty smart guy when it comes to finance! And Jacob's blackberry vibrates again. This time he remov it from his pocket, doesn't check it and simply turns it
And if I know our central bank -- which I do -- I predict it's going to throw gasoline on this fire with more cheap money and federal bailouts and
statistics on productivity and inflation. And Gordon stops pacing... takes a moment for effect. 21. Then sums it all up with...

So no good deed goes unpunished and all fires start with a well-meaning spark and when you take free money and no lending standards then add it with unaccountable risk and ungodly leverage and unbridled greed... what you end up with is cancer. And Gordon takes in a deep breath...
Systemic, malignant and global. Now the room is completely silent.
Do they still have the V&T restaurant on Amsterdam? Is that still there? A stunned girl in the front row shakes her head.
(with a smile) God, I loved their pizza.
Jacob looks on as Gordon is surrounded by professors and students alike...
(announcing to the throng) I'll give you six minutes then I really have to go.
Gordon quickly walks out with his PUBLISHER, a woman in h 40s and heads into the quad. Jacob immediately matches th stride.
Mr. Gekko, can I speak to you for a moment? As he keeps walking...
You're too late, Sport... Q&A's over.
My name is Jacob Moore and I'm dating your daughter.
I'm going to ask her to marry me. And this makes Gordon stop and finally face Jacob with... 22.
I'll give you nine minutes.
As Gordon and Jacob leave the campus and take to the stre
Keller, Zabel? Then you have my apologies.
Yeah...
Stock's in a free fall. My guess is that it just lost its Bar Mitzvah... Jacob quickly takes out his blackberry, turns it on and checks to see Gordon's right... KZI... $12.54.
By the end of the day it might not even be potty trained. And Jacob looks at him.
I might not be allowed to trade, Jake, but I still love to watch from home.
Andrew Zabel took me under his wing when I was in high school. He basically got me my scholarship to Yale then hired me right out of business school.
Andrew's smart, he beats the benchmarks consistently. He'll land on his feet.
He's dead. And Gordon stops walking and regards Jacob. Who confirms.
He killed himself this morning. As that registers...
I'm sorry to hear that.
He was a father to me. 23. And Jacob coldly shakes it off then sucks in a deep breat and looks into Gordon's eyes... genuine and lofty...
I love your daughter very much and I would be honored if... And realizing what this is... Gordon starts to laugh... w throws Jacob off.
... you would bless-- I really don't understand what you find so funny.
My daughter hasn't spoken to me for eleven years and you know it. She blames me for her brother's overdose and every other disaster that's fallen upon the world since the mid-nineties.
And by the way, isn't it strange that Winnie would date a guy from the street?
What?

She hates me. And she hates Wall Street and everything it represents... so don't you find it curious that she would fall in love with you? And that slams into Jacob... who's frozen for a beat. Jacob finally snaps out of it then joins Gordon.
So you want my blessing?
Yes.
I guess I should know a little about you first. Where did you grow up?
Matinecock.
I'm impressed.
It wasn't like that. I mean we didn't have much money. My mother was a tailor. 24.
And your father... what did he do?
Disappear. And Gordon regards Jacob for a long moment, taking him in until...
Clever. Jacob looks down the street.
What are you looking for?
Your town car. With a laugh...
Well, pal... As Gordon pats Jacob on the back...
... then you're going to be looking for quite awhile. ... and heads for the subway.
Gordon takes out his wallet and produces his metrocard. Jacob notices a picture of Winnie in the wallet.
Can I see that? Gordon shrugs and shows the picture to Jacob. It's of a young Winnie and younger Gordon on the back of gorgeous white horse.
She was eight in that one. It was taken in Egypt.
Can I... have it?
She doesn't keep pictures from her childhood. Gordon slowly nods. 25.
What do I get in return?
You... wanna make a trade? And Gordon thinks about, then...
Yes. I'll give you this picture and in return... I'd like a picture of Winnie... taken recently... without you in it.
I don't have one on me. Gordon sighs, takes the picture out of his wallet and han it to Jacob.
Then I'll give you this one on margin.
As they wait for the train... Jacob produces the ring box and opens it to show Gordon t ring.
I really did come to ask for your blessing.
No, you didn't. Nice ring... As the train arrives...
It's so typical. (inside of an ironic laugh) Levered to the hilt... and with the ship going down... As he gets on...
... they still gave you a bonus.
Gordon stares at a one sheet advertisement on the wall. And he doesn't look at Jacob when he says...
Don't play me, Jake. You don't think I can see it in your eyes? You don't think I know that look?
I know it by sight, Kid... because I lived it for years. Christ, I can even smell it on you.
Smell what on me?
Revenge. Jacob just looks away.

Some hedgehog said bad things about your company. It caused the stock to plummet and made those bad things become true. And Jacob now sees the poster that has Gordon's attention It features a pile of money being blown out the window un the caption that reads... "If this looks familiar to you. it's because you're renting!"
The man you loved like a father threw himself in front of the uptown five this morning and you want to bring that hedgehog to their knees.
You knew he was dead? "Guardian Mortgage... Low down payments... Adjustable rat
Like I said -- I still love to watch from home. And now Gordon turns to face Jacob with...
So don't insult me by pretending to ask for Winnifred's hand when what you really want to know is who to bring down to their knees and how to do it. And Jacob swallows that back... doesn't argue it.
I know who.
Really?
It was either Nassim Tariq from the Frontier Fund, Bretton Woods from Locust or Karen Molina from ESL. 27.
Does Winnie even know you came to see me?
Well, not exactly.
But I'm going to tell her.
Not such a grand idea, Pal. Off Jacob's confusion...
See, I have a feeling you're going to want to see me again. And if you tell her we had this little pow-wow... she's not going to let that happen. As Jacob considers that... the train slows to a stop.
Look, you seem like a smart kid.
Walk away, dust off your resume and get another job... As he steals one last glance at that Guardian Mortgage ad
... but do it quick. And with that, Gordon moves for the doors. But Jacob steps in front of him.
I'm going to bring them down. Whoever floated the rumor for a quick buck.
It's not worth it. It's a waste of energy and time. See, Jacob, nobody gets it... they never did. As the subway doors open...
If there's one thing I learned in prison it's that money is not the prime commodity in our lives... time is.
And your nine minutes are up. And Gordon Gekko gets off the subway... leaving Jacob on train. But right before the doors close, Gordon stops and turns with... 28.
There are worse ways to go than jumping in front of a train. For instance, could you imagine taking something for your diabetes... As the doors close...

.. and end up having it cause you to die of acute pancreatitis? And as the subway pulls out of the station, Jacob Moore j stands there... holding the pole and wondering what the h that was supposed to mean.

location: ANDREW ZABEL'S MATINECOCK, LONG ISLAND HOME

text: A Victorian Estate on a bluff. Zabel's funeral in progres Hundreds of people made it out from the city. All types.
Andrew didn't have children, so he made all you -- all of us -- his children.

And to list Andrew Zabel's many accomplishments would take me far too long to enumerate, but if you just look around you, you'll see those accomplishments in the faces of the many people gathered here today. And we pan the procession of mourners... past...

The alumni of the Morris High School class of 1997... who -- through the adopt a grade program -- Andrew pledged to pay the college educations of every member who graduated and got accepted into a University. ... past...
The members of the Saint Helena Symphony, who Andrew provided emergency funding for when they were facing extinction.
And the many, many, other recipients of Andrew Zabel's generosity. ... and past...
Those who were left behind... those who were overlooked... those who otherwise would never have stood a chance. 29. And we land on Jacob L. Moore...
Above being just a great financial mind... or a great husband... He wears a dark suit... and a blank expression...
... or a great father... or a great neighbor... or a great friend... ... with nothing but cold retribution in his eyes.
... Andrew Zabel was a great man.
Most of the guests across the pool eat and quietly mill a We're with Jacob, Willy, Audry and another trader named DANIEL.
Two dollars a share?
The Fed didn't give us a choice. Jacob walks around the room... taking in the pictures of Andrew Zabel's life...
Does that include the building?
What about the Zabel's institutional managed fund? How much is in that?
Eight billion.
And that's all intact.
Jesus, United Bancorp made out like a bandit.
We could've handled it at $60 a share or even $50. He just shakes his head...
It was that fucking rumor. It was so well timed. And the market doesn't care... shoot first, ask later. 30.
Lemmings.
United has a huge trading desk.
Yeah, we're all out of a job. Jacob pulls away from the wall of pictures...
My mother was a tailor. They all look at him.
Out of our house less than five miles from here.
You're from Matinecock? I thought you didn't grow up with mon-- Jacob confirms...
We weren't rich. Everyone else was.
She altered their clothes and I carried their golf clubs. And Jacob looks at a picture of Andrew Zabel one more tim
He gave me a seat at the table. ... and goes.
Jacob heads for the main house. He sees BARBARA ZABEL, Andrew's wife, sitting next to the some friends. Jacob slowly walks over and when she sees him... she stands... wobbly and full of tears.
Jacob... Jacob takes her into his embrace...
(through her sobs) You were a son to him... Squeezing her tight... fighting back a rush of emotion. 31.

I was a fucked up kid, I was angry, my mother couldn't control me. He was the only one who cared. I wouldn't be anywhere right now if it wasn't for... And Jacob Moore stops short... finally breaking down... allowing his own tears to stream down his face. He pulls away...

If you need anything. She nods. And Jacob moves away from the people and moves across the lawn. But he stops when he sees a woman standing across t way... we've seen pictures of her. She's in her late-twenties with a natural beauty that mig take two glances to notice. But after that second glance. it's unforgettable. She's WINNIE GEKKO. As she rushes to him...
Jacob, I'm so sorry.
Why didn't you tell me?
Lehigh had the committee hearings and I knew he would need you and I didn't
That's not how this works. And she looks into his eyes.
Jacob, that's not how this works. He nods. Regards her for a beat, then...
Will you marry me?
What?
I got a ring. Not on me, but--
Are you proposing to me at a funeral?
Yeah. 32. And then...
I had a whole thing I was going to do in DC but seeing you... the words just kind of fell out of my mouth... I don't know.
He would've loved you doing this here. Jacob agrees. And she softly kisses him and squeezes him tight... tears in her eyes.
Yes... I'll marry you, Jacob. Hugging her back.
By the way, I don't have a job anymore.
Awesome.
Glittering in all its glory. Pull back to be in...
Winnie looks up from the ring.
It's beautiful.
Yeah...
It's too expensive. We'll return it.
No.
Jacob I don't care about what ring you give me. You know that.
We're not taking it back. I worked hard for that ring and I want you to wear it. She regards him... he's serious.

Okay. 33. He moves to her... takes the ring and places it on her finger. Then Jacob pulls her into his kiss... it's almost violent She's taken off guard. And as they fall into each other then back onto the bed..

The whole floor is dead. The tvs are off. Jacob cleans out his desk, Audry cleans hers out as well across the way. Jacob wipes his forehead and glances up at the large lett on the wall "Keller, Zabel Investments." And he shakes his head in anger and frustration...
Hey Audry. She looks up.
You cover pharm and biotech.
I did.
Who are the big players in diabetes treatments?
Lilly, Abbot, OSI, Inverness.
Is anyone riding on something in phase three?
Few midcaps maybe. You want me to check? He nods. She turns on her computer and takes a seat.
Oh, this takes me back to when I had a job... He stands over her shoulder.
Yeah, Amlyn pharmaceuticals has Byetta going in front of the FDA next month. I remember this...
they pulled it during phase two because some of the test subjects died but they've obviously solved those problems now.
How did they die?
I don't remember.
Pancreatitis?
Yeah. That was it. Jacob shakes his head...
How did he know?
Who? Without answering her...
Can you look up large institutional ownership?
Mutual or hedge?
Hedge.
Locust Fund owns a shitload. And she looks over to Jacob with...
Bretton Woods. As he takes in that information...
Want your severance, Audry? And he kisses her on the forehead...
Short Amlyn pharmaceuticals. ... and goes. 35.
As Jacob peruses the paintings that are going up for auct with Hedge Fund PM.
What the fuck is pancreatitis anyway?
A private gym on Greene street. As Jacob spars with a BLOGGER from streetaccount.com...
I don't know exactly but it's not something you wanna come down with.

5000 square feet of space, exposed brick and Minotti furniture. A private wine tasting is being held. About fifteen people look on as the SOMMELIER describes t details of the bottle he's uncorking. Near the back, find Jacob standing with a MORGAN STANLEY PRIVATE CLIENT GROUP PORTFOLIO MANAGER.
(whispers to Jacob) When's the FDA coming down with their decision?
As they stand in front of a huge Sigmar Polke...
Any day now.
While showering Jacob with quick jabs...
Where's your information from?
Holding the wine he's supposed to be sampling but not drinking it...
A doctor that's very close to the trials... and that's all I can say.
As they move on from the Polke... 36.
But listen, I'm out of work now so I can't afford to get behind size on this trade... I'm only telling you because you've helped me in the past.
As he removes his head gear and wipes away the sweat.
This is completely off the record. So please...
As they receive the next glass of wine...
... don't tell anyone.
Jacob gets off the train and sees her across the platform Winnie. And as he brings her into his embrace...
Jacob and Winnie have dinner with her boss, SENATOR KATHE LEHIGH, 50's.
Your boy's coming up in the polls. Senator Lehigh nods.
They're blaming this mess on the current administration... it's helping us. And some people say that the worst isn't over.
Her father. What's the word he uses... systemic. Winnie looks over to Jacob.
When did he say that? And Jacob takes for an extra long moment... holding her look... then comes to a decision and lies...
On Charlie Rose. 37. But Winnie continues to glare at him... until...
(with a smile) Okay -- so when's the big date?
As New York opens for business...

The prevalent pay site for all hedgefunders, trading desk cowboys and large individual players. Looks like a scrapp internet start-up with mismatching cheap office furniture As our blogger from the gym sips his coffee, fires up his computer and starts to type...

A small well appointed two-bedroom in Cleveland Heights. Jacob wakes and leans up. He regards Winnie sleeping next him. He softly kisses her neck. She smiles in her sleep then rolls over. As their bodies intertwine...

A huge industrial space in the highline district that hou this eight billion dollar hedge fund. Find a meeting in progress with all of the fund PORTFOLIO MANAGERS. This is known as the weekly idea storm session. where each PM pitches new trade ideas. As Hedge Fund PM stands up to present to the team with a confident smile...

Dressed for work, Winnie heads into the bedroom and regar Jacob still laying in bed. She kisses him on the forehead, lays a section of The Washington Post on his chest with a little laugh then goe As Jacob looks down to see... it's the classified jobs section.

Midtown, corporate, high-floor. Find the private client portfolio manager we remember fro the wine tasting. 38. He sits at his computer in a big corner office with a beautiful western view to the river behind him and types an IM window "AMLN short -- FDA to deny Byetta" then hits send. As he receives the digital receipt... "1209 instant messa sent."
As Jacob munches toast and watches Fox Business in his underwear...
... another stock that's getting beaten before the bell is Amlyn Pharmaceuticals. The stock's down nine percent in premarket trading on no news. Jacob smiles.
When we come back we have Blue star Airlines' CEO Bud Fox discussing how he turned his once small regional airline into the country's third largest carrier.

A select group of Financial JOURNALISTS sit in small meta chairs in front of a podium with the Amlyn name and logo behind it. As the INVESTOR RELATIONS OFFICER heads up the podium and opens his prepared statement...
Jacob watches "Happy Hour" on Fox Business as Winnie open bottle of wine in the kitchen. She pours a glass of wine another of water.
If he wins... she has a real chance for a cabinet position and I'm pretty sure she'll take me with her if she can.
He's going to win. As she hands him the glass of water...
Don't jinx it. And Jacob sees Amlyn Pharmaceuticals graphic on the scree and turns up the tv. 39.

Big drop in Amlyn as negative rumors on the street forced the company to admit there are still internal concerns about Byetta and pancreatitis. They now may be forced to pull the phase three drug from FDA review and retool.
The stock takes a twenty-eight percent haircut.
Can we watch something else? Jacob brings her in and kisses her...
Whatever you want. Her phone rings. As she goes to answer it...
Project Runway.
Not Project Runway. Picking up the phone...
Hello... who is this? Hold on. As she pulls the phone away from her ear and looks over t Jacob...
It's for you... someone named Bretton Woods?
Jacob rounds West 62nd street and stares down the hottest address in Manhattan. A little nervous, he sucks in a dee breath then heads into the building.
A BUTLER lets Jacob in. Jacob takes in the massive space with an insane view of Central Park. He can hear a beauti sonata playing in the next room.
I'm here to see Bretton Woods. The butler nods then leads Jacob through the full floor u and into the...

A huge chandelier hangs over the all marble room. A fireplace on one wall and a twelve foot wall of glass featuring that park view on the other. And Jacob realizes that sonata is live. He's walked into recital of some sort. About twenty people sit watching a YOUNG GIRL play on a v unique looking silver grand piano. The girl can't be a day over thirteen. She's playing Mozart's "Ronda Alla Turca"... her fingers gliding across keyboard in precision, her eyes closed in inspiration. It as spectacular as it is moving. Jacob takes it in for a moment then looks over the room. ethnicities and types... The AFRICAN LEADER in full tribal gear, the DISHEVELED AR with his GAY NOVELIST LOVER, the NEW YORK KNICK with his MODEL WIFE, the MOVIE STAR with her TEENAGE SON. And BRETTON WOODS... Mid 40s, slicing jawline, deep set eyes, in great shape, refined, composed and masculine. He's the owner of this penthouse and he's looking right a Jacob. Jacob looks away. And the young girl finishes the last movement of the sona to applause. The guests all stand, some go talk with the girl. Bretton heads over to Jacob.

As you can see, I'm having a little dinner party here but I thought it was important we speak right away. He speaks with a British accent.. Jacob nods. Bretton looks over the room for a moment, scans his guest then back at Jacob...
Please... if you don't mind waiting in my office, I'll be in a minute. And the butler is already at Jacob's side, motioning him follow him.
Jacob waits for Bretton. He looks over the place. The vie of the park. The classic furniture.

head_text.subj: AND THE HUGE PAINTING ON THE WALL

text: Of a giant man-like monster eating a much smaller naked human. The smaller man's head's been bitten off and blood drips down the body. Jacob holds on the painting.
Saturno devorando a sus hijos. As Jacob turns to see Bretton standing in the doorway.
Saturn devouring his son. Francisco Goya. Bretton heads in and closes the door behind him.
Do you collect?
No. Sitting behind his desk...
Only the obsessive compulsive or the insecure egotistical feel the need to collect things. Jacob nods. Bretton just looks at him... making him nervo
Your daughter's an amazing piano player. That was quite a show.
That wasn't my daughter. That was Isabel Patrovsky, she's the world's greatest living piano prodigy.

And that wasn't a show... that was a very expensive private recital. There's a long beat of silence with Jacob just looking at Bretton... taking him in. And it's unmistakable -- the one thing that this man exud above all else... is composure.
You cost my fund three hundred and forty million dollars today. Off of Jacob's slight smile...
Yeah, kills my year, pushes my watermark higher and might cause redemptions.
I hope you're happy. My fund's in trouble now. Jacob just shrugs.
You don't want to deny it?
No.
Who told you?
A doctor I know. Bretton nods... regards him.
I checked with all the desks in town... you didn't make money off it.
That's right.
Then why did you do it?
You destroyed my firm.
Your firm destroyed itself.
You killed Andrew Zabel.
Andrew Zabel killed himself. And Bretton sighs...
The rumors were true.
You made them true.
No, Jacob, being levered thirty-eight to one in toxic debt made them true.
Institutional money-running was Zabel's talent... he didn't have a down year in the last twenty. Jacob just glares at him. 43.

His fatal flaw was allowing the children on his mortgage security desk to talk him into the deadly game of hot potato everybody's been so fond of playing recently. And Jacob holds Bretton's look for a moment, then... head for the door without saying a thing...
Come work for me. Jacob stops and turns...
What?
I run three billion dollars. Come help me run it. And Jacob takes a beat... processing this...
Why me?
Because your loyalty desired revenge, your balls actually attempted it and your skills pulled it off. As he stands...
And as for Andrew Zabel... there really is no telling why he did what he did.
As far as I'm concerned, it was just a bit of money... and there are surely more important things in the world. And Jacob sucks in a deep breath -- containing his anger.
Now I'm going on Safari with my family. Think about the offer and get in touch after the July 4th holiday. ... heading for the door...
You got my attention, Jacob... and that's one of the rarest commodities out there. And Jacob just regards him, then... 44.
You can have my answer now, Bretton... I have no interest in working for a fund that's in trouble. Bretton smiles...
Touche. Jacob nods... holding Bretton's look. Then...
What's your number?
Excuse me?
The amount of money you would need to be able to walk away from it all and just live happily-ever-after.
Everybody has one -- it's an exact number -- what's yours? And Bretton takes a moment to think about that, then simp says...
More. ... and disappears into his penthouse.
Jacob heads out of his building to be greeted by...
You know what I overheard a guy say yesterday?
I know you're going to tell me... Diego smiles...
"This market's just like a divorce. I've lost half my money... only I still have my wife!" As he goes into the hot summer day...
Not bad... 45.
Jacob heads up to the restaurant to find Gordon Gekko wai outside.
There's a wait.
Oh...
Fifteen minutes she said.
Okay.

No, that's not okay. Because it means they're crowded so every tier in the service chain will be extended. The sixteen minutes we would normally wait to order will now be twenty six, the standard twenty four minutes waiting for our food to arrive will turn into thirty nine, the eight minutes to get the check will become seventeen and the four minutes to process the credit card will take nine.
I told you I'd have lunch with you... not give you a hundred and six minutes of my time. Jacob just stands there.
Let's go to Whole Foods.
Gordon and Jacob share a little table out front of the ma Gordon enjoys a turkey burger from the deli while Jacob d eat.
Did you eat before?
Just not hungry.
Yeah... I used to not eat lunch too. Jacob nods and slides something across the table. The picture of Winnie in workout gear, flipping the finger. Gordon looks at it and laughs. 46.
Fitting. As he places it in his pocket...
That'll make it a round trade for us.
I actually owe you one now. Off Gordon's look...
I crushed him.
Did you?
His fund is bleeding. I wouldn't be surprised if the redemptions finish the job.
Well, Chief... you seem awfully proud of yourself.
How'd you know about Amlyn? Gordon shrugs.
It's amazing what information you can find out when people know you're not going to trade on it.
So, you didn't use me to make a little money? And never to look up from his lunch...
Naw. I prefer to write about the action now than be apart of it.
Why'd you give it to me?
You're out of a job and most likely going to marry my daughter... I figured you could use the money.
I didn't make any money off of it. 47.
You didn't trade it? With a smile in and over-the-top faux innocence.
That would've been insider trading, Mr. Gekko. Gordon just shakes his head.
And not "most likely."
Winnie and I are engaged. As Gordon finally looks up from his burger... impressed.
As they walk up Park Avenue...
So did you take my advice and not tell your new fiance about our little friendship. Jacob doesn't say anything. And Gordon doesn't press.
So, I'm guessing she's not going to take your last name.
Good guess.
That's my Winnie. I knew she was a feminist when she was five and furious that Mrs. Claus didn't get enough credit. And this makes Jacob smile... then...

My brother has two daughters. I had Winnie and Rudy. (sucking in a deep breath) And since Rudy... you know... well, I've worried about the name. It's something you don't really think about until you hit sixty or so but it's important. As they walk some more in silence, until...
I want you to get my daughter to accept me back into her life again, Jacob. 48. Jacob slowly nods... not surprised.
Because save for the extremely precious and depreciating asset of time... she's all I have. As Gordon stops in front of a Georgian-style, pre-war building and turns to Jacob...
C'mon, I'll show you some more pictures of your fiancee that she doesn't want you to see.

Gordon and Jacob get into the elevator, Gordon pushes "4. The doors begin to close but someone gets on at the last moment. He's a hedge fund type, real SLICK, reminds us of Gekko twenty years ago. Oh... and he's about 29 years old.
Gordon... Gekko nods. Slick hits his floor... "PH."
Sky still falling?
You know it.
(inside of a derisive sigh) Sells books I guess.

No doubt about it, this is a nice place. Worth three mill dollars, maybe four at the beginning of the year. Sparsely decorated. Large framed photographs line the wal Gordon shows Jacob pictures of Winnie's childhood.

She refused to take that cowboy hat off. She actually slept in it. Smitten, Jacob looks at some more of the pictures then stands... taking in the large framed pictures on the wall As Jacob checks out a framed chart for "Gouda Tulip Bulbs 1 1634 to Feb 5 1637." The chart goes straight up and to right then straight down in a single line. 49.
Tulip mania... the art of a bubble.
Bretton offered to hire me.
And did you accept? As Jacob moves over to an another piece.

Fuck no. Jacob now finds himself looking at a political cartoon fr the early 1900s. It's of two men rowing a boat in a lake of dollars. One o the men is Uncle Sam dressed in US flag colors. But Sam's very small in this cartoon... can't really row the boat. The other man is much bigger and clearly doing the heavy rowing. He is...

JP Morgan... he single-handedly stopped the Panic of 1907 by stepping in and buying up shares in all the companies that were crashing. Everyone else quickly followed like lemmings. (re political cartoon) See -- people had stopped looking to their government or trusted advisors. They looked to JP Morgan. It was all about simple psychology -- every crash should have a JP Morgan to step in and save it. As they walk the hardwood floor...
See Jacob... the best opportunities are found where angels fear to tread. And they arrive at the next piece on the wall... a small framed bond.
That's a bond issued by the Central American country of Poyais. Gregor McGregor made a fortune dealing these to the British elite in 1820.
The country didn't exist. And now Jacob notices a very strange picture across the room... he goes over to look at it. 50. It's very old... black and white... of a woman filling he stove with money.
Weimer Republic of Germany 1922. Inflation turned to hyper-inflation and it was more efficient to burn the money for heat than spend it.
That's horrifying.
I know. As they both hold on the picture...
What caused it?
A country in debt... that took on even more debt to fund a war... then printed mountains of money to avoid a depression and other financial imbalances... As he turns to face Jacob...
... sound familiar?
And you honestly think this is where we're heading? Looking Jacob head on... deadly serious...
If we don't take our heads out of the sand... yes. It's going to get bad out there, Champ, I'm not going to lie. Even the small regional bank I started out at might go under.
Hudson River Bank...
That's right. And then...
And I've got some news for you... he ain't bleeding. He's not even cut.
What are you talking about? 51.
What I'm talking about, Jake... is that I'd bet dollars to donuts that Bretton Woods unwound most of his position in Amlyn last week. That he knew about the pancreatitis. Off of Jacob's confusion...
The only reason you think you hurt him is because he wanted you to think that.
How do you know that?

I don't. But it's not Bretton's first rodeo... and my instincts for this sort of thing don't often disappoint. Jacob can't believe it. And with each passing moment of realization... shock turns into rage.
I can't believe it.
Believe it, Princess... he's beating your ass all over the court. As Jacob tries to calm himself.
And you think I should take the job -- bring him down from the inside? Gordon confirms that with a simple shake of the head and.
I don't know, Jake... what you kids think is pay-back these days is really incredible. When I was coming up, we slaughtered men.
There are guys still working at penny ante brokerages in the Poughkeepsie's of this country because they crossed me. While Jacob processes that...
So I'll make you another trade, Jake. I'll help you bring him down, if you help me get her back. As Jacob just looks away... non committal. 52.
... then you both can have a father.
As Jacob walks... on the phone with...
Jacob, I could lose my job. ... who holds his sleeping infant in his hands.
Robby, I need to know. Now nobody moves size in this town without using your desk.
We'll play twenty questions only it'll be two questions and all you have to do is say "yes or no." Capitulating with a sigh...
Fire away...
Bretton Woods... The Locust Fund... did they make any major moves in the last few weeks?
Yes.
Was it unloading Amlyn pharmaceuticals?
Jacob...
Robby, I got you the fucking the job! And after a long moment.
Yes. Jacob stops walking... sucks in a deep breath...
I'm sorry to make you do that. With that, he disconnects and shakes his head in frustrat And after a moment, Jacob sucks in a deep breath then mak another call. 53.
(into the phone) Okay Gordon... you've got yourself a trade.

head_text.subj: AND WERE BACK ON THE CHART

text: As a circle forms on June 19th then travels down the tren line to early July and stops. And as a circle is formed around July 4th, we...
Exploding over the Capitol building.

A BBQ for the political set and their families. Paper pla and plastic cups are being thrown away by HELP Children a parents lay on blankets watching the fireworks. Jacob holds Winnie as they look up at the sky...

My parents would always throw this huge party in the Hamptons on the fourth. The city of South Hampton would have its firework show at 8pm then my father would wait until it was over then put on his... which, of course, was always twice as spectacular. She leans up, sips her wine, then...
Then one year the city passed an ordinance that their firework show had to be the last of the night... they were sick of getting shown up by Gordon Gekko. Jacob laughs...
What'd he do?
He rented a barge and shot the fireworks off of it a mile off the coast... out of jurisdiction. (then... almost to herself) The show was even more amazing over the water. And Jacob looks at her. 54.
I think he should be invited to the wedding.
No.
Winnie, he's your father... As the fireworks explode into their finale...
You don't know him.
I know he's unhappy. Look at him out there... trying to scare everybody. He's desperate for attention.
This is none of your business.
"That's not how this works." Remember? She just looks away...
He's got nothing. The firework show ends and everyone applauds...
And that's what he deserves. Suddenly, everyone begins to look over to the house where something is happening...
The things that came out after he was convicted. The affairs... the things he was recorded saying... SECRET SERVICE PERSONNEL, wearing ear pieces, start walki the lawn.
This wasn't the man we knew, Jacob. It was... sociopathic. She stands up and looks across the lawn to where all the action is.
It was a long time ago. He stands and kisses her... 55.
Just consider it, okay? That's all I'm asking. She holds his look for a long moment, then... nodding ove all the excitement...
C'mon, you can meet the next President of the United States.

A massive foyer of black marble with wall to wall views o Manhattan. There's much more space than furniture here. Jacob waits patiently in a white suede chair... he checks watch and sighs. He's been sitting here quite awhile. Finally, the SIX FOOT TALL RECEPTIONIST, leaves her desk. her heels clicking as she walks over.
Jacob... are you ready? Jacob stands and she leads him toward a bank of elevators The doors open and Jacob gets on.
Jacob stands there with Six Foot.

Do you have everything they said you'd need? Jacob nods... holding a folder of his previous tax forms, passport and other documents obviously needed for the job And the elevator doors open... but not to an office... Jacob shields his eyes to the wash of daylight... then lo to realize that he's on the roof of the building. And in front of him is... An Augusta A109E Helicopter wit "The Locust Fund" written on the side.
As Jacob looks down to the city below, wondering where th hell they're going...
Jacob emerges from the Augusta and looks across the tarma see a Boeing 727 with "The Locust Fund" written on the si And now Jacob knows why he needed his passport. 56.
As the 727 dives down toward Biggin Hill airfield... the lights of London twinkling to the north.
The Black Maybach limousine pulls up out front of a 19,00 square-foot Victorian home with the perfectly restored br exterior. As Jacob gets out of the car and sizes down this incredib home...

location: BRETTON WOODS'S CHELSEA HOME/THE BLACK SWAN HOUSE -

text: The design is much different that Woods's New York CPW penthouse. It's more classical... with dark woods and wor leathers and thick rugs and commanding views along the Ri Thames. And Jacob is lead into the...
Where Bretton eats alone at the head of the long table.
Jacob. As Jacob walks through the expansive space...
Mr. Woods.
(Call me...) Bretton. ... and sits.
Okay... Bretton. I thought we were going to meet in New York.
And I thought you had no interest in working for a fund that was in trouble.
I was emotional. I was angry.
And what changed?
I caught a glance of my portfolio. 57. And Bretton laughs. Jacob notices two huge chocolate brown French Mastiffs sitting at Bretton's feet.
Cute dogs.
Dogue de Bordeaux... bred to kill. But Contango and Backwardation here are socialized since birth so they're harmless. Jacob laughs...
You named your dogs after technical futures market terms? And Bretton stands...
Of course not... (with a wink) My children did. As he heads into...
A fire burning in the fireplace. Jacob follows Bretton in
And where are your children? Bretton moves toward a table with a classic phonograph pl on it.

Greece with my wife. My boys are studying The Iliad now. While Bretton looks through the various sleeves of record Contango and Backwardation slowly find their way into the room and sit by the fire. Bretton finds what he's looking for... removing the recor from its sleeve.
Here it is... one of the most beautiful pieces of music you'll ever hear. Bretton places the record on the phonograph and The Rolli Stones "Let It Loose" rings out... 58.
"Exile On Main Street," without a doubt The Stones greatest album. Jacob laughs. He was expecting Beethoven.
It was all outtakes. Throwaway tracks. And the critics hated it. And it didn't sell well at first.

But now it's universally known as their best release. I asked Mick once how he thought that happened. How something could go from so worthless to so valuable. He just looked at me and said... "it never went from worthless to valuable... just the opinions of it did." Taking a seat...
And that was the greatest lesson I ever learned about investing.
An asset's value can only be priced at its perception.
Exactly. There is no intrinsic. Then... simply...
You'll work out of the New York office. I wouldn't want to pull you away from your fiancee in Washington.
Thank you.
She's Gordon Gekko's daughter.
That's right.
He was a legend at one time. It's quite sad how he publicly cries out wolf now. Bretton stands and stretches.
You see, for a legend... 59. Inside of a tired sigh...
... the only thing worse than death is becoming irrelevant. And Bretton just sits there... enjoying his scotch while taking in the Stones tune...
Jacob stands at the window of his suite... looking out on the Victoria embankment and on the phone with...
Good work, kid -- you're on the inside now.
He's going to Dubai to raise some money then meeting me in New York to set me up. Gordon sits at the dining room table at his apartment. Papers scattered about and his EDITOR waiting patiently.
No.
What?
He's not meeting you in New York.
Why not?
Because you need to go to Dubai with him.
I don't understand.
As the 727 takes off ...
You need to do something that will earn his trust... you need to make yourself a hero...
Jacob sits across from Bretton who enjoys a slice of Pizz and a Coke. 60.
Jacob... you need to help him get this money. And Jacob glares at Bretton like he might kill him.
But be cautious. Your relationship with Bretton is still fragile -- you fuck it up here and you're done. Bretton looks up and Jacob immediately replaces his glare with a smile.
Looks better than meals I get on United.
John's Pizza on Bleeker. It crossed the Atlantic with you yesterday. Would you like a slice? Jacob declines... then...
I appreciate you wanting to help with this part of the business even though it's not your expertise.
Well -- there's a lot I can learn from you.
For this trip just stay in the background and observe. As Bretton tosses some pizza to Contango and Backwardatio

We're going to meet with Oleg Bakunin. He's a Russian oligarch on the run because Putin wanted to steal everything he owns. He already has a few hundred million with us but I'm looking to get half a billion more. Our maintenance fee on that alone would be ten million a year.
My father didn't make half of that in his twenty-six year career. And he looks out the window...
He worked in a mid-level job for United Bancorp actually... 61. Never to look from the window... with just a trace of disdain...
Got a fishing kit when he retired.
The most bizarre, stunning city in the world -- outlandis skyscrapers, marinas, archipelagos... And the 727 is now flying over...
A collection of man-made islands that make out a one- dimensional map-like depiction of Earth. As we fly over this archipelago...
Richard Branson purchased Great Britain, Rod Stewart bought Germany, Tommy Lee bought Greece.

It's custom outfitted Mercedes-Benz van that's completely decked out like the inside of a private jet. Full entertainment system, recessed LED lighting, tray tables, fine leather, blacked out windows that "defog" with the p of a button, designed by Phillipe Starck and made custom $450,000 (once you get to the top of the waiting list.) Jacob and Bretton ride into the city. Bretton takes a cal on his Vertu.
Yes... you have to be kidding me. He disconnects the call with a mischievous smile and turn Jacob.

Looks like a bit of news broke while we were in the air... And Bretton turns on Fox Business to see footage of... Th Governor of New York standing at a podium next to his WIF He doesn't look happy as he says...

The remorse I feel will always be with me. Words cannot describe how grateful I am for the love and compassion they have shown me. From those to whom much is given, much is expected.. 62. Jacob's confused... Bretton's enjoying every second of this...
He's been after us for years...
I have been given much -- the love of my family, the faith and trust of the people of New York, and the chance to lead this state Laughing with delight...
Oh Jacob... you don't want to live in a glass house if you're gonna play this game.
I don't understand. Is he resigning?
Yes sir.
What'd he do? And Bretton simply turns to him and says...
Outsourced.
1,000-foot-tall feat of modern design, perched on the edg the Persian Gulf. As the Jetvan pulls out front...
There's a big party for Oleg tonight at a club called The Left Bank. It's Roaring 20s themed so I've had original suits from that era delivered to our rooms.
As Jacob and Bretton walk through the ridiculously opulen lobby plated in gold leaf.
Remember. Hedge funds are not banking and this isn't Ivy-league-geography- ninth-hole deal making. 63.
As they walk down the hall to their suites... Contango an Backwardation tagging along.
Oleg's a brute, he's has A.D.D. and he likes to party. As they stop in front of large double doors... the BELLMA opens the doors to reveal...

head_text.subj: THE BURJ AL ARAB PREMIERE SUITE

text: Makes the Rainman Suite at Caesar's look like a standard at a Motel 6. 7000 square feet, 360 degree view, 70 inch plasmas share the walls with Picassos and Monets. Bretton nods over to the double doors across the hall...
I'm just down the hall. (with a smile) I hope you don't mind I took the nicer one.

Now dressed in a tightly-fitting suit over a white shirt wing collars and stove-pipe skinny trousers, Jacob stands front of the mirror. As Jacob throws on a top hat and admires the 1928 version himself....

A Roaring 20's party is taking place... it's full-on speakeasy vibe. It's right out of 1928, only with Europea Russians and Middle-Easterners. Smoke fills the room. A jazz band roars. Drinks flow. As Jacob and Bretton head in...
If he offers you a drink -- take it. And with that, Bretton points across the room where OLEG BAKUNIN sits.
If he offers you a line of coke -- snort it. He's in his mid-40s, overweight, sweaty, draped in tight black Prada and smoking a cigarette. 64.
If he offers you a child -- raise it. And it seems A MODEL BOMB has recently exploded at Oleg's table... leaving the skinny shards everywhere. Oleg sees them, stands and opens his arms.
Bretton Woods has arrived. Bretton smiles. They head over. Oleg turns to one of the MODEL GIRLS next to him.
I want you to meet one of the only men in the world who might be as rich as I am. Wait a minute... Bretton what did oil close at today?
A hundred and twenty-nine dollars a barrel.
(to Model Girl) Forget what I said -- I'm much richer than him. Oleg then looks at Jacob.
Who the fuck is this?
Oleg, I'm Jacob Moore. It's nice to meet you. Oleg regards Jacob for a beat, then back to Bretton and a again...
Who the fuck is this? Bretton smiles...
Jacob has recently come over from KZI to work with me. And now Oleg turns to Jacob.
KZI? You worked with Andrew Zabel? Jacob takes a beat. Then...
That's right. 65.
He was a legend. Jacob just nods, not showing any emotion. Oleg motions fo the girls to make room and they all sit...
It was that mortgage shit. He should've just focused on managing money and not fuck around with that crazy mortgage shit. Bretton just looks away. Jacob stays cool.
It was a shame his fund was only for institutions... I would've liked to have invested. Oleg motions to a WAITRESS who immediately pours vintage champagne.
In honor of the theme tonight, have a glass of 1927 Heidsiek champagne... Oleg hands Jacob a flute before he can decline.

This is one of two hundred bottles discovered on a shipwreck off the coast of Finland... thirty grand a bottle. And Oleg aggressively puts his arm around Jacob, bringing into a drunken half-bear hug and spilling most of the champagne out of Jacob's flute.

Oleg and some of his crew lead Jacob, Bretton and three beautiful, giggling model girls down a trail to a seclude mooring. Fishing boats bob violently in the water -- and next to t is Oleg's Phoenix 1000, his personal, 65-meter SUBMARINE. As a boatman helps them all climb aboard:
Phoenix 1000.

As they walk through the ornate deck saloon: Oleg beckons Jasper toward a huge panoramic window lookin out at the city of Dubai. 66. And then the view starts to MOVE. The surface of the wate RISES before them, Dubai recedes and the submarine descen spectacularly into the depths.
5000 square feet, 30 days of oxygen capacity.
Lights illuminate the dark waters as curious fish flit pa Jacob, Bretton and Oleg are on divans, the girls undulati around them.
Bretton, I have... what?... two hundred million with you.
And hopefully that's just a start. Oleg, there are so many opportunities out there right now I feel like a kid in the candy store. Oleg waves him off.
You know I like to spread it around... I'm like my own fund of funds. I don't like to have too much with one manager. As Oleg shakes cocaine out of an envelope...
You never really know who to trust in this world. Jacob takes a beat, swallows nervously, then...

I couldn't agree more, Oleg. It's one of the first things that Andrew Zabel taught me. I worked very closely with him. It's why Bretton hired me. To get behind the Andrew Zabel curtain. Bretton flashes Jacob a look... "What the hell are you doing?" Jacob swallows back some nerves then continues...

You said before that you always wanted to invest with Zabel but couldn't because he only handled institutional money. Well here's your chance. Zabel taught me everything he knew. Oleg looks up to Jacob from the line of coke with interes 67.
Such as... ?
Well, I'm not going to give you the whole cake, Oleg... He looks over to Bretton who still glares at Jacob...
But I can give you a little bite...

It involves building positions in high yielding stocks new to volatility then writing calls with split strike prices. And Oleg regards Jacob for a long moment, a jury determin the verdict... Jacob holding on to that sly smile... Bret looking away... playing it cool.
It's complicated but like Bretton said -- right now there are more opportunities than ever. Oleg simply nods... with a simple...
Interesting. ... then does another line.
Jacob sleeps. There's a knock on his door. He stirs. The knock's louder. Then... Jacob finally wakes, moves to the door and opens it to see... TWO BEAUTIFUL RUSSIAN WOMEN, PAULINA and NADIA
We're here for the party. Confused...
What party?
Oleg said you needed a party... Cozying up to her friend with a smile...
... and we're it. Jacob nervously thinks, then... 68.
Come in.
We pan across the suite... past the roaring fire...
Right there... ? ... past the empty bottle of champagne...
No... not there...
How about there? I bet you want me to do it there. ... past the plate of half-eaten chocolate strawberries..
No... I want you to hold it. And find the three of them...
But it's gone up so much. ... sitting at Jacob's computer... looking over a chart f Russian oil company.
I know... but if you're going to correctly utilize this technical head and shoulders strategy, you need to hold the stock until... (pointing on the chart) ... right here.
I always sell too soon.
Very common mistake. You need to cut your losers short and let your winners run. She looks to her friend with a smile...
Good advice for everything... no? Her friend agrees with a laugh. And Jacob checks the cloc
Okay. I think enough time has passed. I appreciate you guys keeping our little secret. 69. As he walks them to the door...
You must love her very much.

I do. Jacob opens the door to let them go but he hears a door o across the hall... Bretton's. And they all witness a YOUNGER AMERICAN WOMAN leave Brett room then head down the hall right by them. Jacob's stunned.
The most famous hooker in the world. Off Jacob's confusion...
that had just left Bretton's room looks right at us under caption "The Governor's $5000 Mistake" Pull back to be on Perezhilton.com Jacob Moore sits in front of his computer. And he turns t Paulina.
Is she a gift from Oleg?
No. She's Bretton's go-to.
He flies her in wherever he's at. And Jacob slowly takes that in... absolutely floored.
Wearing sunglasses, Jacob greets Bretton at the elevators
You look like crap. They walk for the exit.
Let me ask you something... was that speech about split strike prices and stocks new to volatility for real?
No Bretton. That was all bullshit. 70. Bretton smiles.
Well, it worked. Oleg's wiring us five hundred million dollars today. And Bretton turns to Jacob... impressed.
Good job, Jacob... And as they head out into the Dubai heat...
So he trust you now.
The iconic charging bull of Wall Street.
I think so. Travel the park to find... Jacob and Gordon stopping at t food vendors.
Well, I'm happy to help.
What about your end of the trade, Sport?
Oh... I'm still working on it.
I'll talk to her. I promise.
Hot dog.
What do you want?
I'll take a pretzel. As they get their food and walk...
So you're a hedge fund cowboy now? Shaking his head...
Goddamn hedge funds -- what a racket. Playing the world casino, betting other people's money with leverage. And it's completely legal and completely unregulated.
The hustles they get away with make insider trading seem like a parking ticket.

head_text.subj: SLAM INTO THE FRONTIER FUND/TRADING PIT

text: Rows and rows of computers in a large dark room....

Nassim Tariq and his Frontier Fund. With their slews of MIT grads who become glorified millionaire robots pushing buttons... ... with casually dressed ASIANS and INDIANS in their 20s working the keyboards like zombies.
... slaves to top-secret propriety elegant algorithms that work until they don't.

head_text.subj: AND SLAM INTO ESSEX CAPITAL ADVISERS/CONFERENCE ROOM

text: A stuffy conference room half-filled with bored MEN in th 40s watching a presentation...
Or the baby cub funds like Sammy Rosen's Essex Advisers... filled with Goldman Sachs and Julian Robertson pedigree. Most of the men type on their blackberrys... one is actua asleep.
Men who are way too rich, lazy and tired to run money properly anymore.

head_text.subj: THEN SLAM INTO THE DANIELS ACTIVIST FUND/ALLAN DANIELS'S

text: A small cluttered office with papers strewn about...
Or Allan Daniel's and his bully operation. ALLAN DANIELS, a small bull-dog of a man, paces back and forth... dictating in anger. His SECRETARY types down eve word he's shouting.
... with his angry letters to company boards that are nothing but veiled threats in the name of activism.

head_text.subj: AND RIGHT BACK TO BOWLING GREEN PARK

text: Where Gordon stops walking... 72.
So you're inside... you have his trust... and now you want to know what's next. And Jacob's look over to Gekko confirms this.
Here's the thing about Bretton. He puts all of his money into his own fund which makes him stupid, egotistical, and most importantly... vulnerable.
And he chases. He doesn't take losses well and he chases with leverage. He thinks he's a trader, he thinks he's an investor but he's not. He's a gambler. Regarding Jacob...
That pretzel looks good. Jacob just shrugs.
Care to make a trade?
Whatever. And they trade. The hotdog for the pretzel.
As for your end of our trade.

Find a way for me to reunite with my daughter, Jake. Because we both know how she would react to the fact that you've been lying to her about bonding with your future father-in-law. Just standing there... holding that hot dog...
Is that a threat? Looking Jacob dead on...
Absolutely. Jacob just shakes his head with a laugh... now realizing Gekko talked him into this position for this exact levera
You're priceless, Gordon. 73. With a smile...
Just be happy I'm on your team.
Get him into a bad position and watch him chase it.
What bad position?
What have I been saying all along, Kid?
Financials.
They're a death trap -- mark my words.
As Jacob takes in his new view... it's spectacular.
But he won't fall for a brokerage or bank play this late in the game. Everyone knows they're poison.
As the office grows furniture... a plasma on the wall... a computer on the desk...

Sell him on insurance. There's a case to be made for those stocks... ill- fated as they may be. ... books on the shelves... pictures on the walls... a couch and table... a paper shredder and waste baskets..
But take your time... make him think you've been doing your due diligence. Find Jacob at his desk... working away at his computer... it's late at night.

Make it look like you're working your ass off to find him this genius trade... come in early, leave late and don't bring up the idea for at least a few weeks. And Jacob finally gets up from his desk... goes to the window... looking across midtown Manhattan... 74.
And then Jacob... ... eyes pasted on a building made of glass and steel... building he once called home...
... sell him hard... then watch him bite... then watch him chase... ... KZI Investments.
... then watch him come undone.
Holding his suitcase, Jacob emerges from the elevator and heads for a waiting town car. Jacob sees Diego...
Bring it. Diego smiles... loves this new one...
What's the most dangerous question on Wall Street?
Tell me.
"How are you?" And Jacob agrees whole-heartedly as he heads on his way.
As the sun rises over our nation's capital.
Winnie and Jacob jog the park through the humid July haze It's very early. And Jacob stops jogging. Catches his breath. She keeps running.
Why are you with me? She stops and turns back to him.
What? 75.
You hate finance. You hate Wall Street. Why are you with me? Winnie nods. It's a valid question. And she thinks about for a moment, then...
Repetition compulsion.
Huh?
It's Freud.
And what does it mean, psych major?
Well, it's when people repeat the same dysfunctional relationships from childhood in their adult life in hopes of trying to master them.
Like when children of alcoholics fall in love with alcoholics.
Yeah. He turns away... upset.
That's great, Winnie.
Jacob, that might be why I was initially attracted to you... but it's not why I love you. She moves to him.
I love you because you're compassionate and you care so deeply about what you do and you have like no ego, it's crazy. She reaches to him... turning his face to meet hers.
And you're the smartest person I've ever met... and there's nobody I trust more in the world. Jacob looks away... almost ashamed. And Winnie can sense something's not right. 76.
What's wrong?
Nothing... As Jacob draws in a deep breath, collects himself and fin turns back to her with...
I just wish you would master that relationship from childhood so you can move forward with this one.

head_text.subj: AND WERE BACK ON THE CHART

text: As a circle forms on July 20th then travels down the tren and stops. And as a circle is formed around August 11th, we...
And Manhattan... as it sweats through the heart of summer Two jetvans ride uptown...
As Jacob rides with Bretton...
Bretton... I found something I like. Bretton looks over to him.
I've been wondering when my new portfolio manager was going to come to me with something special.
