I just wanted to make sure I would be bringing you the smartest idea possible. I know you don't go light. Confirming...
That's right. If I commit to this... we go large and we don't back down.
It might be better to do this in the office. I have color and support to
Waving him off... 77.
C'mon Jacob, you know that's not how we do.

2.7 million acres of State protected majestic land. All nature... rivers and lakes... cypresses and maples. Clean air. And trails. Many trails that go on for miles. As the two Becker jetvans arrive at a restricted area, a STATE RANGER opens the gate and allows them to drive thro then park. Jacob and Bretton emerge from the jetvan.

This is how we do. And with a nod, the DRIVER of the other jetvan opens it t reveal two motorcycles inside. Bretton's MTT Turbine Superbike and an Agusta, these bikes are handcrafted work art as much as they are demons of speed. Jacob laughs in disbelief and excitement.
And we're allowed to ride these through here? Sucking in the fresh summer air...
No.
Now decked out in leather riding gear... on the bikes... the mouth of the trail... revving the engines...
Follow me... And with that, shoots into the forest. Jacob quickly follows.
Winding through the trees... along the side of a river... Bretton riding extremely fast with Jacob trying to keep u Bretton reaches a clearing and waits for Jacob to catch u Once he does...
You're going to have to keep up.
Okay. I'm just getting used to it. 78.
Tell me your idea.
Here?
Where else?
Right. Okay.
Are you still short any of the financials?
No. After KZI, I took profits.
I think it's time to go the other way.
Banks?
Insurance companies. I'm talking the old school insurers that have become the babies thrown out with the bath water. Jacob waits for a reaction from Bretton. But all he gets is...

Keep up! And with that, Bretton rips into the clearing. Jacob ride just as fast. They're neck and neck... it's definitely a race. Bretton pulls ahead but Jacob doesn't give up. As they move quickly toward a patch of forest with a only narrow trail entering it, Jacob focuses on the horizon an revs the bike into more speed. He pulls up next to Bretto as they approach the trail. If Jacob doesn't slow down, and fall in line behind Brett he's going to hit the trees. But he doesn't. Instead, Jacob blasts the bike into its final dose of spe narrowly avoiding impact by zipping into the trail... pul ahead of Bretton and taking the lead.
As it sits still in the setting sun. Untouched by man. Bretton and Jacob get off the bikes and walk to the shore As they catch their breaths and enjoy the beauty... 79.
The basket of stocks I'm putting together focuses on reinsurance brokering and management services for businesses. They're trading below book and have large dividends.
I say we buy them here. Bretton thinks about it. He's not sure.
Financials are a falling knife. Jacob nods...
I'm not arguing that... but the best opportunities are found where angels fear to tread. Jacob can see... he has Bretton on the hook.
So yeah -- they are falling knives. But Bretton... And with confidence... driving it home...
... what's life without a little blood on your hands?
As WORKERS install an electronic ticker that wraps around top circumference of the whole office... similar to the o Andrew Zabel had.
Okay. Then I want you to build positions in your favorite three names. Jacob picks up the phone and...
With Jacob on top and Robby on the bottom. As Robby takes the order and starts typing into his Bloomberg...
I want you stealth. Use all six trading desks we're in business with.

head_text.subj: NOW ROBBY'S HALF OF THE SCREEN SPLITS INTO 6 SMALL BOXES

text: Six different trading desks... six different BROKERS taki calls from Jacob who still owns the whole top half of the screen.
And if they go down... we increase our size.
Leaning back... feet on desk... staring at the ticker... which only has three stocks on it...
See Jacob -- I don't believe in "wrong." MCC at $21.65, ACN at $16.24 and ISS at $7.23.
I only believe in "not right yet."
A rainstorm takes over the city. A cab pulls out front of Shun Lee Cafe.
Winnie sucks in a deep breath.
He chose this restaurant. Jacob confirms.
We used to come here every Sunday night. He takes her hand.
You're going to be fine.
I'm only doing this for you.
No. You're doing this for you. She just glares at him.
We're never having sex again.
Then what my friends say about marriage will be true. 81. And she nervously fights back a smile...
Oh, shut up.
The HOST leads Winnie and Jacob through the grand dining room. Gordon sees them and stands up. We can tell he's anxious as well.
Hi. Fighting back the nerves...
Hey. They just stand there. Jacob holds out his hand.
Mr. Gekko, I'm Jacob Moore, we spoke on the phone. Nice to finally meet in person. Gekko just looks at him for an extra long beat, then... shakes his hand.
Yes. They all sit.
Jacob, shall we get some wine?
I don't drink.
Oh... okay. Then Gordon attempts a smile over to his daughter.
Let me guess... the ginger garlic lobster.
I used to order that every time. She closes her menu.
I'm not really hungry. 82.
I've been following your career, Winnie. Senator Lehigh said some very nice things about you in The American Prospect interview.
Yeah. She's really been... very... supportive of my... And it trails off... as she just glares at Gordon.
I can't do this. She exhales, stands and looks down to Jacob.
I'm sorry. I can't do this. And she quickly walks off. Jacob frozen. Until Gordon loo over to him with...
It's okay. This is a long term investment.
Go after her. She needs you. And Jacob does. As Gordon looks down... disappointed.
Pouring rain. Jacob runs after her.
Winnie... Winnie... He turns her around.
You don't understand. Her tears being washed away by the rain.
My mother couldn't handle Rudy. He was so out of control. I couldn't help him. Jacob takes her into his hold...
If he wasn't in prison... if he had been there. I know it would've been different.
Your brother's dead, Winnie. 83. Squeezing her tight...
Your father isn't.
He's not the person people think he is.
It was a long time ago. She pulls out of his embrace...
He'll hurt us. Can't we just go home? Please... Jacob. It's raining. And he just looks at her for a long moment... soaking wet shivering... crying and exposed.
(what am I doing?) I love you. You don't have to do this.
Let's just go home.
Darkness. The phone rings. Jacob answers it.
Yes. INTERCUT WITH...
Your insurance companies are down. He's working a coffee in the master suite of The Black Sw Home...
Bretton.
I want to increase our size. Glancing at the LCD, 12:23am...
Okay. Good. It's just a matter of time before they turn. I'll call the
Jacob, I want you to triple our positions on all three. 84. Jacob takes a beat.
Okay.
And they better fucking go up. Click. And as Jacob just looks at the phone...
The instant you know you're in trouble is the exact moment when a sound investment thesis turns into blind hope.
Jacob sits across from Gordon at this well-known breakfas spot in the Parker Meridian hotel.
Tripling the size... that's a very aggressive move. Jacob nods.
And I promise you he's using leverage to do this.
He's chasing. Suddenly, a MAN approaches the table. He's in his thirtie
Mr Gekko, I'm Tom Sanders. I write for Barrons.
I've heard of it. Letting out a little laugh...
I'm sure you have.
Well, I'm doing a piece of Wall Street moguls who ended up going to prison. I've already talked to Boesky and Milken and would love to sit down with you.
Can you give me the cover? Tom isn't sure if Gordon's serious. Either is Jacob. 85.
Well, I... um... don't make those decisions.
Get me the cover and I'll give you seventy minutes. Tom politely smiles.
I'll... take that as a no. ... and goes. Gordon looks down to his breakfast and quie asserts...
(almost to himself) Both those assholes got the cover when they were convicted. And after a moment...
How do we know the insurance companies are going to continue going down? As he casually places his egg on a piece of toast...
It's all going down. ... and takes a bite.

head_text.subj: AND THREE CHARTS NOW FILL THE SCREEN

text: Side by side... above the charts are written respectively MCC, ACN and ISS. And we follow all the three trend lines from Aug 17th for to the right... and they all move down.
Just wait. And we stop in September. And as a blue circle is formed over Sept 13th on all three charts, we...

This is The Financial Follies... an annual event held by financial writers association. 500 people sit at tables, enjoying this dinner and live s that pokes fun at people in the world of finance. Everyone who's anyone in high finance is here. 86. On the stage, the spotlight finds BILL MAHER and the appl breaks out...
Welcome to the 2008 Financial Follies!
I'm Bill Maher and I'm getting paid in Euros. Jacob shares a table with Bretton, Bretton's wife and a f other FINANCIAL PLAYERS. Winnie is not here.
When The Financial Writers Association asked me to host an event for the world of finance, I was shocked. I'm known in Washington not Wall Street...
... but then they informed me that Washington is actually in the process of buying Wall Street, so it all makes sense. Laughter...

I asked them if anything's off limits. And they said to stay away from the brokerages, banks and insurers... (pause for effect, then...) ... where the fuck was that advice five months ago? More laughter.
I see Sammy Rosen's here. The spotlight finds SAMMY ROSEN, billionaire hedge funder
Sammy, how are you? From his table...
Doing well.

(to the room) Of course he is... in the amount of time it took for us to have that exchange, he made three hundred and nine thousand dollars. (back to Sammy) Sammy, let me give you some free advice, the next time someone with bad eyesight wants to sell you a hundred and fifty million dollar painting... don't let them personally deliver it. 87. It's an inside joke that this room gets...
Somebody told me Gordon Gekko is here. Gordon... ? Across the room, a spotlight finds Gordon...
There you are. I have some inside information for you, Gekko... sex sells books, not bread lines. Gordon smiles and raises his glass up to Bill.

Talk about your sour grapes. Seriously Gordon -- just because the SEC doesn't let you make obscene amounts of money by being wrong and nefarious doesn't mean you have to ruin it for all of these hard working people. The room applauds...

Okay, we have a video to show now. It's a very detailed and academic account of the current mortgage crises. Let `er rip! And the room goes dark... and on the screen plays a child roughly illustrated stick-figure skit being narrated by children.
Under the caption "Main Street National Bank" is a drawin a Poor Man sitting across from a Banker Man behind his de
I'd like a mortgage... I don't really have any money though... is that cool?
Totally cool. Since housing prices are always going up it won't be a problem.
You guys are awesome!
Under the caption "A few weeks later at the bank..." Banker Man now stands over a pile of steaming shit. 88.
Wow, these mortgages are really beginning to smell. I better sell them to smart people.
Under the caption of "Smart People Investment Bank" Smart stands over the same steaming pile of shit.
Wow, these mortgages we just bought really smell. I better sell them to foreigners.
Under the caption of "The CDO Factory" our smart man over an assembly line of stick figure workers.
Mix those crappy mortgages in real good with the clean ones so the rating agencies won't smell them.
Under the caption of "Rich Man Hedge Fund" a stick figure named Rich Man sits behind his desk and holds a phone to ear.
Good news, Smart Man, not only did foreigners buy those traunches, but so did school boards and charities and big pensions.
Why did they buy them you ask? Well, they were looking for a really secure risk-free investment and they were all triple A, so...
Under the caption "Norwegian Village Pension Fund" a Norwegian Man sits behind his desk and shouts into his ph
Hey man! What the fuck? We're not receiving our monthly payments!
Under the caption "Rich Man Hedge Fund," Rich Man at his on the phone.
Yeah, we fucked up. 89. And it now shuffles between the last two frames... the Norwegian Man and Rich Man.
What about the rating agencies?
Yeah, they fucked up too.
What about the investment bank that put these CDO's together?
Fucked up.
What about the bank that made the original loan?
Totally fucked up.
What am I supposed to tell my villagers?
That you fucked up. The final frame Just the rendering of that steaming pile of shit under th caption... "The End." And the lights go on to a some subdued laughter and a smattering of applause.
What a year -- enjoy the night!
Desert is served. Jackets are off, cigars are lit, Bretto wife has gone home. The group at the table is a little dr and having a good time.
It's a good question... what do you think, George? GEORGE, an investment banker at the table, thinks about i
The definition of rich... flying private. The table reacts... some agree, other don't. George turns Jacob. 90.
Jacob... ? What do you think?
To be rich... is to have the love of a good woman. They all boo...
(with a smile) For real... I truly believe that. And Jacob turns to Bretton...
Bretton... what's your definition of rich? An approaching voice answers it for him.
To have twice as much money as you currently do. As he takes a seat...
Isn't that what you always say, Bretton? Then... announcing to the table...
He brings up the question, runs it round the table then finishes with that. It's an old bit. Also announcing to the table...
Be careful Gordon... (looking at Jacob) ... your daughter's financial health is in my hands now. Jacob loses his smile... suddenly becoming uncomfortable.
That's right.
And the way The Locust Fund has been buying up the insurance companies lately makes me worried about my future grandchildren's college educations.
I didn't tell him. 91.
No, I don't suppose you did. Bretton looks over to Jacob.
Go ahead, Jacob, preach your book... defend your names. And Jacob turns to Gordon...
We have a proactive central bank, the charts show a clear bottom on July 15th and these companies are trading at half of what they were six months ago.
Just cause it's low don't make it cheap, Sport.
I read your book.
It's not out yet.
I have a friend in publishing.
25% unemployment... stagflation... bread lines... Martial law... government seizures of assets and gold... end of democracy... Bretton leans back... taking in this sparring match.
Really Gordon? Do you really need attention that badly?
Since I have forty-four seconds to spare, I'm going to tell you a story. It's about a guy named Sam. And we go close on Gekko...

Sam used to work a job, he made things and he grew things and he sold those things. Until one day Sam got a credit card and was amazed how easy it was to buy things with it. So Sam got another card and then another. Then he used the credit card money to make it look like he had an income... and he used that "income" to secure a loan.
And with that loan Sam bought a fancy BMW car and rented a fancy penthouse apartment.

Now, the credit cards hit their limit and the bank needed him to service that loan, so Sam went to his friends. His Chinese friend... and his Japanese friend... and his British friend and so on. And his friends loaned Sam money.

And that brings us to today... where Sam owes the credit cards and Sam owes the banks and Sam owes his friends and eventually they're going to take away Sam's fancy BMW car and his fancy penthouse apartment. And Jacob can now see... in Gordon Gekko's eyes... he tru believes every word he's saying.
And Sam doesn't make anything anymore and Sam doesn't grow anything anymore so Sam doesn't sell anything anymore. As he stands...
Our favorite Uncle Sam's desperate, Jake... and he just found a printing press in his basement.
So you tell me -- where do we go from here? And with that, Gordon Gekko goes.
It is sad isn't it? That he can't just take his ball and go home.
That he has to piss on the whole game.
Rushed, Jacob heads through the lobby of his building. Di catches his stride.
(doing his best Howard
Down goes Lehman! Down goes Lehman! Down goes Lehman! And Jacob just keeps walking... 93.
Jacob heads into the office to find Bretton sitting behin his desk.
They're not going to save it. They're just going to let it bloody die! And sure enough... on the tv... Fox Business runs footage Lehman Brother's demise. On the screen, the chyron scream

And as another US banking institution collapses, Congress is working quickly on a bailout package that will distribute over three hundred billion dollars to other banks in trouble. Bretton turns off the tv and looks to Jacob with...
We're getting fucking killed. And Jacob looks up to his electronic ticker... MCC $18.53 -2.34, ACN $12.04 -1.35, ISS $7.03 -.65.
It's capitulation. Bretton holds Jacob's look... fighting to keep his compos Until... he simply stands and offers Jacob his desk back.
Then buy more. Jacob takes his chair and reaches for the phone.
Cost us down to current levels. Jacob looks up, surprised.
It's just a question of time before this turns around... right? And he glares at Jacob.
Right. Bretton just stares nervously at the electronic ticker... frazzled gambler talking himself into his bet.
Fuck it. 94. As he goes...
Leverage is sexy.

head_text.subj: AND WERE BACK ON THE CHART

text: As a circle forms on Sept 16th then travels down the tren line and stops. And as a circle is formed around the Sept 24th, we...
LCD reads 4:43 am. Jacob lays awake... staring at the ceiling.
I would hear him in the kitchen. Jacob turns to see she's awake.
I'm sorry, you have an early train. I'm going to just go to the office now. She leans up.

He didn't want to keep my mother awake so he'd go into the kitchen and sit there. I could hear him because my room was right up the back stairs. I'd go and sit with him sometimes. We'd eat ice cream. Jacob gets out of bed and throws on his robe.
I was only eight but I could tell he was worried about something and that made me worried. (softly, almost to herself) Then the market would go back up and he would sleep through the night again.
It's not the market, Winnie. As he sits on the edge of the bed...
It's just that I haven't been able to sleep through the night since... The thought trails off... she leans up and kisses him. 95.
I wish I could tell you something was going to come along that would make it better but I can't. It's just going to take time, Jacob. A lot of time. And she looks into his eyes...
Have you been counting Fridays? He slowly nods.
I still count Tuesdays.
All seven hundred and twenty eight of them. He leans over and kisses her forehead.
Go back to sleep. And he goes... After a beat, she sees Jacob's wallet.

(calling out after him) Jacob, you forgot... She jumps out of bed, grabs the wallet and goes after him but... it opens up and Winnie notices the picture inside. And she stops, staring at that picture. Her and her father on that white horse... taken years ago A picture she knows she never gave to Jacob.
Jacob heads in and turns on Fox Business...

It's a complete unmitigated bloodbath out there. The S&P tried to rally at about 10am but it was met with yet another brutal wave of selling and people... we're now at our lows for the day, the week, the month and the year. Jacob looks up at ticker on the wall. MCC $15.13 -3.40, ACN $10.10 -1.96, ISS $5.14 -1.89. 96. And he stares at that ticker... at the The Locust Fund's methodical death. Suddenly...
Are you happy? He stands in the doorway holding a drink.

We're done. And Bretton CHUCKS the drink against the wall and the gla shatters. Jacob takes a step back. Bretton's in a complete state as he walks over to Jacob's desk and SWIPES it clean... papers flying about.
Finished... Now he picks up the chair...
Bank notices... ... throws it against the window... which cracks.
Margin calls... As he punches the monitor of Jacob's Bloomberg...
Redemptions... And Jacob just stands there... wide-eyed. Just looking at
Face full of sweat... blood all over his hand... hair str about... completely out of breath... bloodshot red eyes.. beaten down mess of a man.
What happened to composure, Bretton?
Well, I suppose it went to hell with your fucking insurance stocks. And Bretton calms down, walks to the window.
It's not making sense to me anymore. The market always made sense to me and for the most part... I was better than it... quicker than it.
But it's moving too fast now and it looks like the world is going to shit anyway. And he faces Jacob Moore.
If I unwind the fund now I'll still walk with six hundred million or so. And Jacob's face falls... this is news to him.
What?
It's time to call it a day. Spend more time with my family. I suppose this moment comes for all of us.
You still have six hundred million? Bretton vacantly nods. And Jacob Moore... trying his best to hide his disappointment...
(almost to himself) That's a fortune. With a shrug...
I guess it's all relative. Bretton then takes a moment... confirming to himself that this is the right decision... then finally looks over to Jacob with...
And Jacob -- you're the worst portfolio manager I've ever seen.
Sheep's meadow... painted in the soft light of sunset. Fr off his morning run, Gordon wears a sweat suit and works vitamin water. Jacob approaches in his suit.
He wants to close the fund... he wants to ride off into the fucking sunset...
Okay... 98.
No, it's not okay... because we're so fucking close... and he's going to walk with six hundred million dollars and that's unacceptable. And Gordon sighs in defeat...
I don't know what to tell you, Pal. You wanted to make him bleed, I wanted my daughter back... As he walks...
... looks like life brings disappointment to us all. And Jacob... as he matches Gordon's stride... in a comple state.
What happened to slaughtering men, Gordon? What happened to turning them into penny-ante brokers in Poughkeepsie? Gordon stops walking.
Look at you. This can't possibly be the man my daughter fell in love with. Jacob turns away.
I want to finish the job.
Why?
Because nobody gave a shit about me before Andrew Zabel came along. Because he didn't deserve what he got.
The universe is an efficient market, Kid... we all get what we deserve.
Did you? Now it's Gordon who looks away.
I know you cared about him... and I know how that motivates. But Jacob... he wasn't such a Saint. 99. And with that, Gordon Gekko heads on his way...
What's that supposed to mean?
You don't want to know. Jacob steps forward... shouting out after him...
I'm sorry she doesn't want anything to do with you, Gordon -- I'm sorry she doesn't love you! Gordon stops walking. Turns...
Okay Jake... you want to know. Jacob sharply nods.
Did you ever think about it? I mean really think about it? How someone could make money year after year... even through bear markets? Jacob just stands there... listening...

On November 15th, 1903 an Italian man arrived aboard the S.S. Vancouver in Boston. He had two dollars and fifty cents to his name. Yet just a few years later he was millionaire. You wanna know how? He had invented a scheme... it was quite simple actually. And Jacob now steps forward... piecing it together...
No...

He would get people to invest with him by offering larger than normal returns then pay the old investors with the new investors money. As long as there was fresh money, he could keep going. Do you know what his name was, Jacob? It was Charles...
Charles Ponzi.

head_text.subj: FLASH TO AN OLD BRICK BUILDING

text: "Jenkov Foundation For Brain Research" above the door... RESEARCHERS in lab coats coming in and out of it. 100.
Research facilities...
STUDENTS walking the quad... wearing backpacks and socializing...
And scholarships...
Somewhere in Florida. A COUPLE in their 70s enjoying a beautiful day... riding bicycles side by side...
And retirees...

head_text.subj: AND RIGHT BACK TO CENTRAL PARK

text: Gordon steps forward...
All of them went to bed thinking they were perfectly fine... are going to wake up to find they're completely wiped out...
You're lying.
I'm not, Son. I wish I were. Jacob just stands there... stunned with what he's hearing
See Jacob, you knew how to get that out of me. By playing me off of what I really want... my daughter back.
So you need get Bretton back in the game... play him off of what he really wants. And off Jacob's reaction...
Jacob shares a table with our Morgan Stanley Portfolio Manager.
It's ugly out there dude. I wake up everyday wondering if today's the day we're going under. 101.
I know. But I do have something for you... And as Morgan Portfolio Manager leans forward in anticipation...
As Jacob and Hedge Fund PM walk the floor... checking out new 2009 Prius.
I was going to get the new Maserati, but... you know... Jacob slowly nods. Then...
So I heard something earlier today...
As Jacob jogs with our blogger from Streetaccount.com.
It's so much better working out outdoors... that gym was so stuffy.
Not to mention expensive.
Right.
So, you've obviously heard the rumor? And Blogger looks over to Jacob... he hasn't.
As our blogger from the gym sips his coffee, fires up his computer and starts to type...
As Hedge Fund PM stands up to present to the team with a confident smile...
As Morgan Portfolio receives the digital receipt... "1209 instant messages sent."
As the cab stops outside of the building... 102.
As the thunder claps outside. Jacob stares at the Goya painting... Saturno Devorando a sus hijos Saturn. The man being eaten alive.
I don't like unannounced visits.
United Bancorp is going under. Wells Fargo has stepped up but the offer is insanely low.
I know all this.
You still have the fund and you still have the leverage that comes with it. You want out of the game... buy a bank. Bretton skeptically regards Jacob.
Why are you doing this?
Because I got you into those insurance companies... because I let you down... And Bretton... biting his lip in thought...
I don't like the mortgage toxic waste. It can't be quantified... and it spreads...
I worked it out already. You wouldn't have to take it.
How'd you do that?
Well, Wells won't insure the Zabel institutional money. It's against their policy. And then...
I told them you would.
Then who would take on the mortgage securities? 103.
Uncle Sam. Bretton slowly nods... taking all this in...
So, I'd get the bank, the KZI assets including the institutional fund yet none of the mortgage securities. As Jacob leans forward... going in for the kill...
You could actually own the bank your father toiled away at his whole career. Think about that, Bretton. Bretton just shakes his head.
We're going to lose our credit. I'm facing margin calls.
So in order to stay in the game... we need fresh money. Bretton nods...
(not going to work) Oil's crashing. Jacob thinks for a moment, then...
And how much do we need?
Fifty, sixty million minimum... and that's just to hold off the current margin calls. And Bretton just sighs...
God, de-leveraging is a bitch. Standing...
Sit tight. I'm going to get us the money. And Jacob goes... Bretton calling out after him... 104.
From who... ?

"Moral Hazard! Why Wall Street Has Finally Gone Too Far" now everywhere. In large cut outs and piles on tables and in the store's windows. Jacob arrives at the end of the line... New York's newest best selling author is having a book signing.
Signs a book and looks up at the LADY who gave it to him.
I have a question... what exactly is "moral hazard?" With a smile...
Short version -- taking risks you're not accountable for with other people's money. And the next person steps up and hands Gordon a copy.
He's going for it. We're almost home. As he signs it...
There you go.
But he needs fresh money to serve the leverage. A hundred million. Gordon just shrugs.
I'm a writer now. We don't make that much. As the line of people holding their new books start to ge impatient...
I know that, but I figured you might know how to get it. Handing Jacob back the signed copy... 105.
Well, if you need money that badly, Jake... you might want to check closer to home. Off Jacob's confused reaction...
As they walk the mall... the Nation's Capitol behind them
It's a lot.
How much?
I don't know, Jacob. I never really considered it mine.
But it is... right? It's your money? And she faces him... regarding his urgency...
(glaring at him) You might want to wipe some of the drool off your face...
I'm not kidding. This is important. As they continue to walk...
Yes, it's mine. When he went to prison, my father put a lot of money in our names. And when Rudy died it all became mine.
But it's in a trust. I can't get to it until I'm thirty-five and even then I was planning on giving it to charity.
Let's say I can figure out a way for you to get it. Take a loan against it -- something like that. Will you do that for me?
Why are you doing this, Jacob? Jacob takes a moment... looking away with... 106.
This is my only chance to make things right, Winnie. And she just regards him... not sure...
As Jacob walks down the hall with KEN HADLEY, estate lawy to Manhattan's elite.
Gordon couldn't invest any of his money so he put most of it into the children's names with directions on how it was to be invested.
He definitely knew what he was doing...
And how could Winnie get it now? Hadley stops walking and thinks about it.
Well, she'd have to sign a reversion of trust document. That way the funds would revert back to their pre-trust posture and regulations.
So all she has to do is sign a piece of paper?
Basically. As that registers...
How much is in there?
It's complicated. There's private equity ownership, real estate, a very large position in a bank... all sorts of investment vehicles.
Ballpark it for me.
I don't know. Assuming immediate liquidity... over three hundred million. And with that, Jacob sets to go. But... 107.
Of course... Gordon would have to sign the document as well.
In the make-up chair of the Fox Business channel green ro speaks into his phone.
You also would need the trust's executor to sign it. INTERCUT WITH... Jacob as he walks down 5th avenue...
Who is that?
Sammy Redding. He's a lifelong friend. It won't be a problem.
What about you?
I would love to sign it, Jacob. Consider it done. Walking down 5th avenue...
Thank you. Thank you, Gordon.
Just after you agree to two things.
Anything.

Before Bretton buys the bank, he must use all of Winnie's money and all the Locust Fund's leverage to go against the market. They're about to pass this bailout and I want to be on the other side of it.
This thing's going to hell in a bucket and I'm sick of being on sidelines, Pal.
But what about--
It's just for a few weeks then it's right back to our plan. 108. Accepting that...
Okay.
What's the second thing... ? And as that hangs...
As she starts to sign the forms... we're in...

Silence. A clock ticks. A large table. Three LAWYERS sit on one side. Winnie and Jacob on the other and Gordon at head. Winnie finishes signing the forms then slides them back t Hadley who hands them to Gordon. Jacob takes her hand but she pulls it away. And after Gordon signs the papers, they all stand. Gordon just looks at Winnie, who's now looking back at hi Tears beginning to well. And he slowly opens his arms...
Winnie... come here... you're all I have left now. And she slowly walks over to him... to his embrace...
He was my only son. And I messed that up. I messed it all up, I know that. She's now crying.
But please... forgive me... And confirming through her tears...
You always get what you want, Dad. And Jacob Moore... witnessing this strange reunion... realizing how right she is...
Jacob's on the phone in his office, watching coverage of vote on the Senate floor... 109.
(into his phone) Okay, it looks like this bailout's going to pass...
Robby, with a phone to his ear...
(into his phone) ... there's going to be an initial bounce... SPLIT THE SCREEN AGAIN... AND AGAIN... AND AGAIN... Each time to another broker with a phone to their ear... six brokers from before...
(into his phone) We're going to sell that bounce.

head_text.subj: AND THEN FOX BUSINESS NEWS COVERAGE

text: Day by day... Alexis Glick starting off the day's coverag And each new day finds Alexis in a different outfit with different headline above her head. We don't hear her, it moves quickly and it's ugly.
First we're going to unload all of our positions in the insurers.
Then we're going to go the other way... we're going to bet against this market... aggressively.
Against the S&P, the Nasdaq, the Dow...
... the financials, China, India, Brazil...
... the brokerages that are still left, all the froth from the last two years...

head_text.subj: AND WERE BACK ON THE CHART

text: As a circle forms on October 10th then travels the trend down even further to late October and stops.
Gentlemen, anything that can be sold... we're going to sell. And as a circle is formed around the date of October 27th we...
Jacob gets off the elevator and sees Diego who doesn't sa anything.
What? No market joke today? Diego just shrugs...
It stopped being funny. Jacob softly nods and heads on his way.
Jacob heads in to find Bretton waiting for him.
I thought you were in London. Jacob nods.
The United Bancorp deal is going to go through. I've begun unwinding all our positions.
But our deal with Gordon was that we have to stay short until November 5th. Bretton just looks at him.
What? 111.
Jacob, Gordon redeemed all his money yesterday. We're clean with him. And this hits Jacob like a ton of bricks...
Is something wrong?
No. No, everything's great. Forcing out a smile...
Let's go buy a bank.
As the LANDLORD walks down the hall with Jacob and Winnie
Thank you, he hasn't answered his phone and we're very worried. The landlord nods and unlocks the apartment door for them

And they walk in to find the place completely empty. Everything's gone save for one thing... that framed pictu of the woman filling her stove with money. Jacob slowly walks over to the it and stares it down...
He played me... She joins his side...
He played us.
I don't give a shit about the money. And she turns to face him.
This is who he is. He sucks in a deep breath, then...
I lied to you. I contacted him. I spent time with him. Without you knowing. 112.
I knew.
You knew?
I saw the picture in your wallet.
Then why didn't you say anything?
Because I wanted to give you a chance to say something first.
Because I love you, I really do. She takes off the "fuck you" ring...
And because I desperately wanted to find something in you to believe in. (shaking her head in
But Jacob... you've become that exact thing I've been trying to master... ... and places it into his palm.
... you've become him.
Hadley sits behind his desk.
It's completely legal, Jacob. The funds reverted back to the pre-trust posture... that means the money was technically Gordon's again. Hadley just shrugs...
But he's not allowed to trade.
He didn't trade.
He put the money into the hedge fund, that's considered capital investment.
Jacob, Gordon never put the money into a hedge fund. He simply took control of the bank. 113.
Bank? What bank?
Hudson River. I told you about the position in the bank. Jacob's stunned...
Hudson River... ? I don't understand.
A sleepy town...

Well, Gordon had placed his Hudson River shares into the trust before he was convicted. You do know he started out there? A rental car parks out front of a small bank. Jacob emerg and heads for the bank...

Okay, then the trust aggressively acquired more shares about two years ago... enough to have a controlling position in the bank. And Jacob stops walking when he sees... a group of angry depositors forming outside and a sign hanging in the doorway... "Closed."
Jacob and Hadley...
But how? Gordon wasn't allowed to control the trust.
That's right. All of the trust's moves were made by its executor.
Sammy Redding? Confused...
Sammy Redding? Who the hell is Sammy Redding?
Jacob, the executor of Winnie's trust has always been Bretton Woods. And as that slams into Jacob Moore... 114.
As Jacob takes his seat and settles in for the long fligh He's flying commercial... and in coach.
It's raining and gray.
As Jacob walks the hallowed halls of this old school stoc brokerage with the MANAGER...
So we're throwing Bretton's birthday party at Balmoral.
Well, we're very proud to have such a resounding success hail from these hallowed halls I assure you.
We've been trying to get Bretton to come back and speak to our younger brokers, but... he's a hard man to reach.
That's funny because he often speaks about his days here at Redmayne and Bentley... anyway, what I'm hoping you can help me with were records of his early trades. Years ago.
We think it'll be fun to bring up some of Bretton's real losers from when he was starting out... you know we all have dogs.
Of course... but it is against policy to allow just anyone to see those records.
I completely understand. How about this? I'll make you a trade.
You let me see the records for Bretton's party... And with a killer smile...
... and I'll make sure Bretton gives your young brokers a speech that will blow them away. 115.

As Jacob looks over the old documents... trading ledgers twenty-five years ago. Down the list we see him circle all the unusually large successful trades. And then follow them to the client # o the right side of the ledger. And Jacob realizes it's the same client # every time. Cli #41.

Wow, Bretton -- you really kicked some ass for client forty one. Finally Jacob turns to the back of the ledger, to the cli key, where he moves the pencil down to client #41 and it says... Gordon Gekko.
(all making sense now) Bud Fox wasn't the only one.
Jacob waits in the large entry hall... holding a cheap umbrella he bought at Heathrow. And down from the stairs walks...
It's been a bitch of a month, my friend... tell me this visit does not bring bad news.
Oleg sips his vodka and looks at Jacob.
You want me to audit The Locust Fund?

That's right. I want you to tell Bretton you need the official records of all the fund's activity starting with when you gave him the original two hundred million. You need this because The Russian Federal Tax Service is up your ass and you have to play ball with them.
And if he declines... ?
You'll have no choice but to pull your money. 116. Oleg lights a cigarette... exhaling the smoke with...
And why would I do that? And Jacob leans forward...

Because if you do this for me, Oleg, I'll teach you the Andrew Zabel magic. I'll explain to you, in detail, all of his techniques... I'll give you all his secrets... it's less complicated than you might think.
Darkness, until... a phone rings. Jacob wakes up and take it.
Hello... Okay, thank you. He moves to the curtains then opens them. And the daylight spills in.
Oleg slides four encyclopedia-sized bounded stacks of printouts across his desk.
All the Locust Fund's trades for the last two years. Jacob nods, placing them into his bag. And Oleg lights a cigarette... looks right at us... excited... leaning forward with...
Now give it to me. Let me behind the Andrew Zabel curtain...
As Jacob flies back to New York. He flips through the Loc Fund trading ledgers, shaking his head in disbelief.
Winnie answers the door to find...
They were working together. Your father and Bretton. Walking back into the apartment... 117.
Jacob, what are you doing here? Following her in...
Gordon wanted the trust the whole time. And when I came to him seeking revenge... he saw his window. Upset, she looks for her keys.
I have to go to work.

Bretton owed him a favor because he fed your father information twenty three years ago when he was a young broker in London and your father never ratted him out. She just looks at him... shaking her head... and not in disapproval... but in pity. But he keeps going.
And he never put the money into Bretton's fund. Turns out your trust had built up a controlling position in Hudson River Bank.
That's the bank he worked at when I was born.
Well, now he owns it. Or shall I say pilfered it before he went AWOL.
And that money wasn't even the bank's... it was taxpayers'... bailout money. As this washes over a stunned Winnie Gekko...
Jesus... And Jacob confirms...
He saw this coming years ago... from his cell. I'm guessing he made off with billions. And he throws something on the table.
And now look? 118. It's a copy of Portfolio Magazine with a picture of Gordo cover under the headline... "Guess Who's Back and Getting Rich Betting Against You?"
He's in London... giving interviews and being hailed as a genius. Everyone's buying his book and waiting to see his next move. Desperately trying to get her mind around this...
But what about the SEC, the regulatory agencies-- ?

The government is flying this 700 billion dollar airplane by the seat of it's pants. They don't know where half of the fucking money is going. And even if they did, do you think they want this out there? As this all washes over her...
This is his revenge.
Yup... sure beats the hell out of insider trading, doesn't it? And Winnie finds her keys and heads for the door...
I can't hear anymore of this. ... but Jacob steps in front of her.
I'm done. I sold everything. The ring. Everything. I gave back the KZI bonus. I'm out and I'm broke and I deserve it. And she just looks at him...
But Winnie, the one thing I can't accept -- is losing you. And before she reacts...

As a circle forms on Nov 6th then travels quite a ways th finally stops. Unfortunately, this slope down the S&P trendline is quite pronounced. 119. And as a circle is formed around Jan 24th 2009, we...
As Jacob opens up a copy of Barron's... Gekko on the cove under the caption "What's His Next Move?"
In an official office of our Federal Reserve Bank, proudl signing the documents...

head_text.subj: AND ALONG THE BANKS OF THE PERSIAN GULF

text: Dubai in the background. Jacob waits against a bench. And across the way he sees... approaching him... Gordon Gekko.
Did you see Barrons?
You finally got the cover. Gordon nods.
Everybody thinks you got rich of betting against the system. If they only knew...
The powers that be will never let that happen. Jacob's not arguing it...
How much is enough, Gordon? Gordon laughs with a shake of the head.
I've been asked that before...

They took a hundred, twenty two thousand, six hundred and forty hours from me... for a goddamn victimless crime. All the while I sit in my 8 by 12 and watch real crooks by the thousands give out mortgages like candy, package them into unexplainable derivatives and spit the cancer out into the world. And he just shakes his head... 120.
And when I get out... who's there waiting for me? Nobody.
You better believe I'm going to get mine.
You're not going to miss America?
I'll always have America... it's why I'm here. I'm buying the island.
I know it's kitschy but it's fun and good for business. Looking over the water...

I have a lot business abroad now. Interests in an Australian copper mine, a German solar company, some Russian oil pipelines, a casino in Macau... see Jake, America just isn't where the action is anymore.
What happened to the precious depreciating asset of time?
It still trades... And he turns to Jacob with a smile...
... but I'm a billionaire now, Pal.
I'm out, Gordon, I'm done trading.
I don't know why. You pulled it off, Kid, you took him down -- granted with my help -- but you atoned for Zabel's sins with Bretton's money.
As I see it, you're just getting started. And Jacob stops walking then slowly turns to Gordon with.
Did you ever really want to reconcile with her?
(of course I did) I'm human. 121. Glaring at him...
Then why did you do it? And Gordon... strongly holding Jacob's glare... simply replies...
Same answer.
But it didn't work. Gordon sadly shrugs...
I've been trying to wire two hundred million into her bank account but she won't accept it.
I know. She doesn't want it... we don't want it.
Because it's not about what you have... it's about what you do. And Gordon -- it's never about the money. Gordon shakes his head.
That sounds good. I bet you can even wrap it in a pretty red bow. But Champ, it's idealistic... and idealism kills every trade.
Winnie will realize that at some point... and then we'll be fine. And Jacob finally looks away... in pity.

See Jacob -- the hustle we all fall for is actually thinking we can fight what's inherent, what's inevitable... that we can somehow undo what genetics, or God, or whatever name you wanna tag it, has placed deep inside of us. Because whether it's greed or revenge or the compulsion to chase... it all amounts to the same thing... loss of control. And it's always going to be there and it's always going to be stronger than you, Pal. Now walking again... 122.
It's why bubbles will always exist and it's why we're all currently in this mess. Joining Gordon's stride...
Winnie's pregnant. And Gordon stops walking.
